Reviews.Title: “One day/night stay”
Reviews.Author: Donhartel
Reviews.Content: I arrived at McCarren without reservations. I called Terribles and their van arrived promptly. The front desk was very nice considering the fact the previous customer was very belligerent. I was very pleased with the price and the room. Not being a smoker I found the ventilation in your establishment to be sub par compared other casinos. That being said, the staff were very helpful, the gaming fun and the room clean and comfortable. The very inexpensive late night steak dinner was just possibly the worst I have ever eaten. The equally cheap buffet was just that, cheap! You might want to check out the other buffets in Vegas. I do want to thank you for the 83 degrees as it was very nice at the pool. I guess the pool is just to look at as the water temp was just above freezing. All things considered I did enjoy my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful!”
Reviews.Author: Dogsdish
Reviews.Content: Terribles is not a high class place, but the prices are great, they have a free shuttle to/from the airport (which strip hotels aren't allowed to have). The rooms are nice (higher scale than you would expect.) The pool although not heated, is very relaxing to sit next to and the hot tub was nice as well. Gambling even kept us playing rather than draining our pockets (like the casinos on the strip and even downtown). Points on the players club card racked up rather quickly giving us a little extra to play with. Food in the restaurant is varied. Some dishes were just okay and some were good. Skip the buffet. It's not worth it unless you've lost your taste buds.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a great price!”
Reviews.Author: LeilaJean
Reviews.Content: When we go to Las Vegas, we always stay at Terribles. We have checked out other places to stay and cannot beat the price and accommodations. Our bed was so comfortable, room was good size. Tip the housekeeper and you will have everythiing in abundance. Good coffee that we had at pool side. Plenty of security and felt safe. Slots were good. We hope to return soon!

Reviews.Title: “Vegas Weekend”
Reviews.Author: suethestew
Reviews.Content: Always try and make it to Terrible's while in Vegas! Great place to gamble as alot of locals gamble there! Players card is worth the sign up. Rooms were very clean and for the price it was well worth the stay. Pool was a little cold, but it was March. Don't be afraid of the name, Terrible's is worth the stop and stay!

Reviews.Title: “Terribles is our favorite stop in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: klankyP
Reviews.Content: As long time guests (over 10 yrs.) we will always stay at Terribles. It may not be one of those fancy hotels that you pay 5 times the price but why pay for a room that you only sleep in. It's not like you are living in the hotel room so as long as it's clean (it is), comfortable (it is) and at the cheapest price (always!) we will always stay here. You don't have to go anywhere because the casino,restaurants, pool, beautiful garden and bar are so easy to get to. Not like those hotels on the strip where you get lost because they are soooo big. Plus the bus stops are right outside the hotel, ready to take you anywhere in Las Vegas. I come from Hawaii where we have one of the best public transit in the US but I can say that Las Vegas has a pretty good system also. So if you want to save money so you have more to gamble I would suggest staying here. A last minute thought... the Player's Card also gives a lot back and you can't beat the free shuttle. We will be back to Terribles soon.

Reviews.Title: “Gambling and Good Food”
Reviews.Author: jes_Adna
Reviews.Content: We were provided a tip from the Condo staff that Terrible's was a great place to gamble. It had several handicapped parking stalls, which helped our access. We played poker video before wandering off to the blackjack tables and other slots. I managed to make $20 last quite awhile on the poker and slot machines and once I decided to join the slot club, the points added up quickly. My husband went over to the tables and while he didn't win big--he did ok before we went upstairs to the cafe. Good prices on the meals and huge portions! Very friendly casino and restaurant. Being off the strip was nice for parking and access!

Reviews.Title: “Playing at Terribles Pays Off”
Reviews.Author: Bill B
Reviews.Content: We had been playing at the MGM and had a food coupon for Terribles so we went to check it out. 15 minutes in the casino, my wife hit a $23.00 jackpot with $3 in the penny slots. Her freind with us hit a $123.00 jackpot minutes later. We went to the Buffee. It was very reasonablwe and the food was great! We will return!!

Reviews.Title: “Fun at Terribles”
Reviews.Author: GrandmaB36
Reviews.Content: Price is Right! Bed are as comfortable as most hotel room beds, except for the rubber/plastic sheet under the sheet. It rattles and makes you sweat. A/C is okay, we like our sleeping room cool at night. NO coffee maker in the room BUT You can get coffee at the bar if you don't go to the restaurant, It is served in a glass, not a cup. Flat screen TV is very nice. Shower is okay. You have to stand sideways in order to shut the door to the bathroom ,but that's no big deal. We have stayed at Terribles Many,Many times and always go back. The shuttle to and from the airport is a BIG PLUS. Pool & hot tub area is very nice & relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Casino Slot Play only”
Reviews.Author: jpvalve
Reviews.Content: The casino at Terrible's just makes you feel comfortable and welcome. As a slot player only when it comes to casino gambling, this is one of my favorites, located just off the strip at Paradise and Flamingo in Las Vegas. Their player's club is generous to its members and makes you feel like you are important to them regardless of your betting level. Great place. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “yeah players club!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sharon T
Reviews.Content: Love to play here. Staff is helpful and friendly. You also do not have to be a high roller to get discounts through the players club.

Reviews.Title: “Name is a misnomer”
Reviews.Author: ShowMeVegas
Reviews.Content: Needing a room for our last night in Vegas before an early morning flight, Terrible's fit the bill with relatively inexpensive rooms during March Madness; a quick, free shuttle to the airport; and a lively little casino with everything available on-site. Normally, I wouldn't pay $70 for a room in Vegas at a place called Terrible's but during a big event it seemed perfect for our purposes. Our room on the ground floor was convenient if not overly expansive. The two beds filled it pretty well but still had plenty of room for the large flat screen mounted conveniently on the wall. It was cozy and comfortable, good bedding and enough room to get to the bathroom. The bathroom...that's another story with a short wall separating one bed from the vanity so you could brush your teeth and shave while watching your roommate sleep. Not so great for my son though, trying to catch every last Z. The toilet/tub area did have a door, lending some privacy and hiding the corroded bathroom fixtures. We only used them once so what the heck. Video checkout at 5 am was nice and it was convenient that the shuttle driver slept in the bus all night. A quick knock on the door and he was ready to roll. Twelve hour shifts are a killer. The casino was fun and we won a decent amount on some very good video poker while enjoying many stout complimentary cocktails. The bald bartender at the sportsbook bar was a little surley with unsolicited fatherly advice on consumption that was unusual for a guy making good tips with good throughput on the machines. Guess he was being forced to work too hard. The bartenders in the back were much more pleasant and accommodating with great viewing of the games on large screens. The sportsbook was small but lively with knowledgeable, friendly, fast window personnel and generally good commoraderie from the crowd. Both gambling and dining (let's just call it "eating") were cheap and the floor atmosphere was active and cheerful. A small store including liquor sales on the property was a nice convenience for those that availed themselves of it. Good gaming promotions and freebies prevailed. We received a free hat & T-shirt just for signing up at the players club without minimum play. A nice trinket. The name Terrible's only applies to the buffet. Our experience was indeed terrible. But the Cafe has 24 hour specials which are considerably better, strange since they share the same kitchen. Cheap food is not always a value as is proven here. There is a good, family-style Italian restaurant across Flamingo from the hotel though. Now it is a value. Given the circumstances, I would stay at Terrible's again. It was a nice respite from the Strip with a good, fun-loving clientele. I won't pay $70 again, but anything below fifty is a decent deal. It's not my ideal of a perfect extended stay property, but I'm sure others would disagree. All in all, Terrible's is proof that you don't have to stay smack dab on the Strip to enjoy Vegas or it's nightlife. It's a viable off-strip option conveniently accessible to whatever you choose to do. My rating is due to more of the positive experience than specifically to the opulence of the property.

Reviews.Title: “Skip the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Linda B
Reviews.Content: Have been going to Vegas for 10 years straight and always stay at Terribles. Inexpensive rooms, food and gaming. The free shuttle to and from the airport is a big plus. Newest machines and friendlier payouts. Shuttle service to the strip means you do not have to pay extra for a rental car. Great swimming pool and hot tub arae, as well as a store for all needed ammenities and snacks, drinks and gifts. Wine and beer also sold there. Restaurant is priced so four can eat for the price of two. Good quality. All around great experience!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at a reasonable price.”
Reviews.Author: ddn
Reviews.Content: Both the room, buffet and cafe give you bang for your buck. It is about 2 blocks off the strip, but there is a shuttle to the strip if you want to go there. We go to Vegas every year and it is one of our favourites. Beds are very comfortable. The pool is set in a lovely lush garden. It is quite and a great place to relax and read, nap - whatever you wish. The buffet has a good variety and extremely well priced with your drinks (non-alcoholic) included. The restaurant has excellent food and very generous portions. The service is usually very good too. The carpet in the hallway is a bit worn and needs replacing, but other than that you should enjoy your stay there. The players club offers great gifts and the points accumulate quite quickly. A various days the points are 5 or 10 times the value!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible's Defiantly Not A Terrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: Teri G
Reviews.Content: We knew of Terrible's through an advertisement brochure in our hotel. It was a nice way to get started gambling for the first time. We were signed up for the players card, receive $5.00 in slot play and a Terrible's T-Shirt. The slots played with you which was a nice change. My roommate it was her first time ever gambling and Terrible's made her feel at home. Great trip and a must see.

Reviews.Title: “For the traveler on a budget”
Reviews.Author: C_Marce
Reviews.Content: Terribles has changed a tad from the terribles 2 years ago. It's still mostly locals but if your into gambling with out losing to heavily quickly... Terribles is for you. Check in is normally quick but dont expect a big hurrah because you're there. Even if you are a return customer their service at check in is somewhat bland. When we checked in we were told to go to the older side of the hotels rooms (when I specifically requested tower rooms). Turns out I did get a tower room but the check in attendant sent me to the wrong area. No big deal. Only 5 minutes lost. After we settled in to our room we went down stairs for a quick snack. Spent $4 dollars on a hot dog, but what a hot dog. The thing was almost as long as the cocktail table at the bar. Food wise they are very affordable. You get double what you expect as far as portions go. All in all you get what you pay for. Since my husband and I go to vegas mostly for a quick get away from Los Angeles, we dont mind that the casino can get noisy. If you are loking for a 5 star experience Do Not Stay here. If you are looking for a relax time and you can mingle with the locals, terribles is for you. Before I stop ill describe the rooms quickly: Rack of the House are clean rooms but are very dated. Beds are not comfy. Tower rooms were renovated a couple years ago... Are better than the rack rooms but are starting to show a little wear, however, the beds are somewhat more comfortable.hope my review helps.

Reviews.Title: “Terribles isn't exactly terrible.”
Reviews.Author: captmorgnsgrl
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 3 nights. The casino is very smokey and the ventilation could use some work. The casino itself is cramped but they payed out pretty good. There are many locals who frequent this place and some of them look to be trades people who eat at the buffet and restaurant. I did see a couple of undesirable sorts, but they were harmless. The rooms were actually really nice, clean and the staff always seemed friendly and were very helpful. The buffet was ok, not the Bellagio or the Rio, but hey you get what you pay for. Their cafe was actually pretty good and we ate there most of the time. In order to get to your room from the outside of the property you will have to use your room key. I liked the fact that no one is allowed in withou a key. And in order to get to your room from inside the casino you have to pass security and the front desk. So if smoke doesn't bother you and your infor a real low budget trip, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicer rooms for the price on a Saturday night”
Reviews.Author: Matt G
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, and pretty comfortable. I stayed here on a Saturday night and with prices soaring in Vegas, this is one of the nicer rooms for the price! It is a few blocks off the Strip, but the do offer a free shuttle to the Strip and the airport. The cafe had great food, and was very reasonably priced! My biggest complaint with Terrible's was that the walls are paper-thin. Most of the night I heard the TV from the room next to me, and very early in the morning there was a lot of loud people in the hallways. You hear almost everything that goes on. That got pretty old, quick!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place Without The Strip”
Reviews.Author: fred c
Reviews.Content: This location of a hotal and casion is fun and the restaurants are very good

Reviews.Title: “Perfect not Terrible at all.”
Reviews.Author: baker29
Reviews.Content: I have visited Terrible's to play Bingo on many occasions but on my last trip to Las Vegas I opted to stay there. I was not disappointed at all. The accomodations were wonderful! The staff was kind and caring. We had a wonderful stay and definitely plan to stay here again! Thank you for your hospitality. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Terribles was terrible!!”
Reviews.Author: kittypaws30
Reviews.Content: First of all we have stayed here a once in the past due to offers they had sent us. It had been about a year and other than the walls being paper thin never had a big problem when we stayed there last time. This time was RIDICULOUS!! First of all we had an offer sent to us for the weekend of Feb 17th..I called they held a deposit for the 1st night ( friday ) for 54 plus tax, I asked the operator if I needed to bring my offer in with me since we are in Michigan and some properties ask for them some do not. She said " No it's in the system " ..okay cool one less paper I gotta haul with us. Time for checkin.." do you have you're offer they sent you?" .. YOU GOTTA BE KIDDING ME!! Long story short they said yes it was in the system but they needed the paper in hand. After everything the desk clerk " Angel " checked me in and said " I will take care of it here's your room keys " Which led me to believe they honored the price since I got the keys to my room...no more than 5 minutes later the phone rings in our room " Hi this is Angel, the rooms are about 100 a night this weekend, If you can't pay you will have to leave the room " WHAT THE HELL!!!??? WAY TO MAKE US FEEL WELCOMED !!! You checked us in, gave us keys, the 1st nights deposit was taken from my credit card that day we called 2 weeks ago, the person who took the reservation said NOT TO BRING IN THE OFFER, now we're being told no it's not going to be honored and we have to leave if we can't pay?? These rooms ARE NOT WORTH 100/NIGHT..LUCKY WE WERE GONNA PAY 54 FOR A WEEKEND NIGHT....the only reason we HAD to stay was EVERY SINGLE PLACE WE CALLED HAD A ROOM FOR FRIDAY NIGHT BUT NONE AVAILABLE FOR SATURDAY, so we would have had to come back to terribles hotel for saturday. We also called housekeeping for a ironing board & iron..we waited just about 45 minutes, noone showed then had to make a second call ..twenty minutes later it showed up. Walls are PAPER THIN,..we could hear the guy in the next room snoring aaallll night. Planes you can hear all of them leaving and arriving, and we are a young couple so we weren't in our room very much THANK GOD!! But when we were in the room it wasn't like we could get much sleep. In May 10 of us we're going to vegas again for 2 weeks, some of my family was planning on staying at terribles..NOT ANYMORE!! Our business will be taken elsewhere. There are hundreds of better locations for more reasonable prices we found..like GOLD COAST OR THE ORLEANS!! BUT THANKYOU TERRIBLES FOR MAKING A FEW OF OUR DAYS THERE JUST THAT!!! TERRIBLE!!

Reviews.Title: “a little gem off the strip”
Reviews.Author: richard y
Reviews.Content: good players club. slots very loose ,atmosphere good, this is one place you really must go to when visiting vegas. drinks very good and often , just dont forget to drop her a dollar and you cant go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Clean comfortable room, great buffet, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: C B
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because our reservation for hotel went bad. Due to president's day weekend Las Vegas hotels were quite booked and we felt this had good value and reviews on trip advisor. We got 2 free buffets for staying there. If you sign up for their players club, you get $3.99 breakfast buffet, $8.99 brunch/dinner along with a buy 1 get 1 free buffet. Hotel had free wireless internet. Our room was clean, comfortable with flat screen TV. It was quiet, spacious. No coffee maker in room, but hotel gift shop had very reasonable prices for coffee, cappucino, wines, beer, gifts, etc. What could be better: less cigarette smoke in casino (turned out better for us since we did not loose much in gambling), cleaner hallway carpet. Location: On Flamingo and Paradise. We had a rental car so it was not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Some problems along the way.”
Reviews.Author: Tim S
Reviews.Content: As other reviews have stated "You get what you payed for". The restaurant up stairs is great for the value. The slots were loose (somewhat). The rooms were comfortable and clean. The staff was either rude or friendly depending if you find one. I had a problem at the ATM and a ticket jam at one of the slots, could not find any one walking around to help you. There is a bus stop located close for both directions to and from the main strip. Free shuttle to and from airport.

Reviews.Title: “good location, easy walking distance to strip”
Reviews.Author: Mark S
Reviews.Content: very convenient with airport shuttle, rooms are great, clean and huge and all with windows! unlike other economy casinos nice gaming area, large but not confusing like other hotels

Reviews.Title: “my visit”
Reviews.Author: Ayana H
Reviews.Content: I live here in Las Vegas and I enjoy going to this casino. The players club is one of the best club. I have players cards at several casinos and thy don't offer a much promotions and specials as terribles. Every month I try to get there so that I can see what type of freebie I'm going to get.

Reviews.Title: “Poker Tables”
Reviews.Author: Luis A
Reviews.Content: The Poker tables were great.. Players were friendly, and not too aggressive.. It was a Fun overall experience

Reviews.Title: “My stay at Terribles Hotel and Casino”
Reviews.Author: Dawn M
Reviews.Content: It is a very comfortable hotel and casino. We had to check-in early and there was no problem and no extra charge. The only thing was I did not find the buffet food that great.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible's Casino”
Reviews.Author: Patricia T
Reviews.Content: Since we live in Vegas we have a multitude of choices. We have found terribles to be somewhat looser on slots. We think the value of the restaurant is very good.

Reviews.Title: “All good”
Reviews.Author: Austrian
Reviews.Content: Have been many times at this Hotel/Casino. Always very pleased. Now they have a good many new slot machines. makes gambling more enjoyable. If you have little patience, don't go to the Bougainville Cafe. Really slow. If the Mgmt. only knew how much money the casino looses be-cause of the long wait for your food. Food is excellent however once you get it. Can only recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Terribles Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NWN100
Reviews.Content: I had an early flight and arrived in Las Vegas at 8am to start my Super Bowl Weekend. I had 1 checked bag, when I got my bag off the belt I called for a shuttle pick-up. Van arrived in 18 minutes, so I said to myself ok this is a good start. I didn't have change for the driver so I proceeded to the front desk and ask "I know I am very early for check-in but could I keep my bag at the front desk until check in?" She said "I can check you in now, if you would like?" I said "Great!" by the way can you break this bill? She had no problem doing so, I went out and tipped the driver. I was at LVH to place my "winning Super Bowl bets and prop bets" by 9am. I won and the family will be back to visit Terribles in March. My vacation started off NICE! Overall my stay was good, with no hassels. ~~~Rooms-Clean~~~~~Hallway-strong oder of cigarette smoke~~~~~~Casino-very smokey not for the faint of heart for non-smokers. This is a locals establishment and I think they like it that way. Location~~~~if your not afraid of walking in the "day"-20 minute walk to the strip. Kind of seedy area at night, take a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Update to my review last year - Coffee makers no longer in rooms!”
Reviews.Author: diost
Reviews.Content: Suprised on our last visit that the coffee makers have been taken out of the rooms. We did get a sheet of coupons on check in giving us a free cup in the gift store/free drink at the bar etc. Breakfast buffet is now $3.99 - but watch out for buy one get one free coupons on tourist info racks. The buffet has been upgraded and modernised and meals are a lot better for the price - get there early! Rooms seem cleaner than they used to be - free wifi still works great

Reviews.Title: “Terribles casino”
Reviews.Author: jniesing8
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a really good deal for the money. Nothing fancy but clean and friendly. The front desk staff is exceptional. The beds are REALLY comfortable. Love the FREE internet and no extra hotel fees!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for here.”
Reviews.Author: TheRealDonquijote
Reviews.Content: Not a great neighborhood. I had concerns for my car in the parking lot. The check-in desk personnel were not at all friendly. As with most casino hotels you have to walk in the casino to register but here the machines hardly give you room to pass with a suitcase. The room was clean and as per the internet photos. The walls are thin and you can here people in the rooms around you. The exterior windows are so poor you hear parking lot and delivery traffic all night. The cafe seats are cracked and in poor condition. As my wife said, "that is what you get when you pay $25 for a room owned by people who are better known for their gas stations. " On the positive side there was no resort fee and the internet was free and fast enough to watch shows online. We paid for two nights but I think we will check out after the first night and stay at the South Point. It is twice the money and no free internet but it is a much nicer experience.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend at Terrible's”
Reviews.Author: Joe A
Reviews.Content: I have mixed feelings about my stay here. I liked some things, others not so much. My first impression when I arrived was that it kind of had that "ghetto" feel to it. The neighborhood isn't that great, in fact I was concerned about parking out front to check in. When I asked for help with our bags, they asked me for my drivers license, and in exchange they gave me an old cart with duct tape on the broken parts of it to go load it myself...lol. That right there pretty much sums up this place...cheap room and eats, no frills.The room was okay, but not as nice as I was expecting based on internet pics. Also the web site says that there are coffee pots in the room...no such luck. The room was physically not the same as the ones pictured on the site, but they were okay. It did seem like the AC unit wasn't cooling properly. The casino was a disappointment overall. The best thing about this place is the food, in my opinion. They only have two resturaunts, one of which is the buffet. The buffet is not excellent, but good, especially for the price. Sat. and Sun. we paid 9.99 for two breakfast buffets. You can't beat that anywhere in Vegas. On Friday night I had baby back ribs, baked potato, and corn on the cob for 9.99. It was excellent. It is nice to know that you can eat very cheaply in your casino when you're hungry. Another thing I liked about this casino was how close the underground garage was to the rear entrance. Very convenient to get to the car from your room. Not sure if I would stay here again, but overall it's a good deal for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great Time at Terribles Vegas Nev!”
Reviews.Author: Gary45931
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay, Service was outstanding and service was great!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time at the Vegas location!”
Reviews.Author: Gary45931
Reviews.Content: Would reccommend the Vegas Terribles to any one and the service was excellant, would reccomd the Casino to any one looking to have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Expectations exceeded”
Reviews.Author: TodHunter
Reviews.Content: I was impressed by my stay at Terrible's. I chose the place because I had a business conference at the Hard Rock (a two-minute walk and jaywalk away) and was amazed by the service and services there. The maids left extra coffee every day on my daily request. The coffee shop had a dynamite $2.99 breakfast special (available 24 hours) to start my day wit. There were no resort fees, so the posted price was what I paid. Best of all, they issued me my own safe deposit box at the cashier's cage so I could stow my computer and valuables there, take the key, and not worry about it. The property is modest and expectations may be low, but these guys meet and exceed everything you'd expect from a small hotel in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “$3.99 Buffet Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: mrwheels
Reviews.Content: Can't beat this deal! Not gourmet but hey cheaper than Denny's

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: CLMDinger
Reviews.Content: It begins with the most revolting air freshner that I have ever encountered and it permeates throughout the property. The place is run-down with stained carpets and old, dis-colored paint. I had to call the front desk because the room had no TV remote, I ended up un-plugging the heater/air because it sounded like it was about ready to blow up and in the morning the glasses were too big to fit in the coffee maker.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, but bad area: $2,000 of vandalization to my car”
Reviews.Author: KVS60
Reviews.Content: This was the 2nd year in a row myself and my startup company staff had stayed at Terrible's for CES (Consumer Electronics Show). We had 3 rooms. In general, we like the great value, convenient location for the LVCC and the Venetian/Sands Convention (where CES has stuff going on and our booth was this year), good sized and clean rooms, easy in and out (motel like, don't have to traipse through miles of casino) and cheap drinks at the bar! There are also a lot of restaurants in walking distance: PF Chiangs, McCormick and Schmick's, Buca Di Beppo , Morton's (though we couldn't eat there on our budget...) etc. So why the 1 star review? My car was vandalized in the south parking lot overnight. Seriously "keyed" on the hood and both driver's side doors. About $2,000 of damage. My insurance will cover, but of course I have a deductible. Security staff was very polite and helpful, and yes this is something that could happen anywhere in Vegas. BUT no one from management attempted to proactively contact me to apologize or offer even the slightest form of compensation (not even a free dinner....). I finally had to request to speak with management, though this was after checking out and the best they could offer was great rates on my next trip to Vegas. And they expect me to come back here? By the way, I believe my car was singled out because it is a Mercedes (though a nearly 13 year old one...). If you have a nice car don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant to visit this off strip Casino”
Reviews.Author: Franchesca P
Reviews.Content: I now live in Las Vegas and I prefer to visit the off strip hotel's.I love Terribles Casino and Hotel it's restaurant and buffet are affordable and their food is a plus not to mention the slot machine's are loose.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem close to the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Alan T
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Terrible's a number of times in the last ten years. Each visit has been better than the previous. This most recent visit was my first in tower room. The room was spacious, bright and clean. Overall this is a great property. The staff is friendly and willing to help.

Reviews.Title: “First Time staying here.”
Reviews.Author: BillBenn
Reviews.Content: I've been in the casino before, but never stayed here. I was a little worried about staying here because you never know what kind of room you'll get at a "budget" priced hotel. Turns out that the room was clean, spacious and had a 46" LCD TV! Free shuttle service from the airport was an added bonus, and the restaurant and buffet were cheap with good food. I'll definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: monique d
Reviews.Content: If you want to be close yet a bit further away from the busy Las Vegas Strip, this is the place. Clean and comfortable rooms, helpful staff and a 10 minute walk to Las Vegas Boulevard. Great pool area

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Geraldine C
Reviews.Content: It is a casino and hotel with a friendly atmosphere. Easy to get around,everything id just a few steps away. The Food is good and priced accordingly. Good variety for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Daniel M
Reviews.Content: Good rooms, friendly staff. Hot tub was great! Good location just off the Strip, would definetely go back!

Reviews.Title: “another outstanding stay”
Reviews.Author: Chris D
Reviews.Content: my father and i stayed 11 nights at terrible's and it was outstanding the hot tub and pool are open all year around and we took advantage of it. the buffett is outstanding, the entire staff is outstanding. the room we had was fantasic, quiet, clean rooms we have been going to vegas since 1994 and we have stayed at many of the big resorts and we now make terrible's our home away from home best value in las vegas

Reviews.Title: “It was a room”
Reviews.Author: menolyfair
Reviews.Content: Was in Vegas for a couple of days and got the room for about $25. a night but that includes internet access which most of the strip hotels charge extra for. Terrible's is off the strip, but I had a car so that was not problem. The room was clean but old fixtures. The hotel itself was dingy. TV only had about 6 stations. If you are going for a place to store your luggage while you enjoy the strip, clubs, shows then Terrible's is good. As my husband says... all hotel rooms look the same when you turn the lights out. I feel I got my moneys worth.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to visit and play”
Reviews.Author: Tonya J
Reviews.Content: Everytme I'm in Vegas I always visit Terrible's because I win and the place is very friendly. I would recommend you to visit this casino. My son took me there back in 2004 and I have been going there every since. I like to buffet and the restauntant. The slots are fun to play and the payout is great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: ben285
Reviews.Content: It does not seem as though the machines pay much here, but when you get a free 3 night stay, a New Years Eve celebration with drinks included and two free breakfasts (with comp points) you dont mind losing a few hundred. Overall, it is a nice casino with lots of new slot games. The rooms are basic, but nice. Housekeeping was good. However, the best thing is the perks you get at this resort if you join their players club. There are a lot of penny machines and had fun even though I lost and lost very quickly. If you join the players club, it is worth staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: daw8534
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing for the price. I cannot say enough good things about it. The beds and pillows were very comfortable and the room was more than cozy. Totally surprised to see the flat screen on the wall. Would recommend all who go to casino to join the slot club as the prizes are fabulous making ones stay even better.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great food”
Reviews.Author: Nate842003
Reviews.Content: Best players club in Vegas also there buffet is very cheap for the value off food keep up the good job thanks

Reviews.Title: “First time stay”
Reviews.Author: john j
Reviews.Content: Nice club, good hotel. It is smokey inside, so be aware you will be choked out before you get used to it. Food was decent, however buffet had luke warm food, the restaurant was much better for food and price. Gaming is good and you play along time on the money you have. It is a little away from the big casinos, but not that much of a deal. Room was clean and comfortable, and a great price especially for Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed”
Reviews.Author: Dustycastetter
Reviews.Content: We didn't stay here but kept ending up here. We liked the casino and the slots we did not do bad on atleast we got some play money. We signed up for a players club and wife got T-shirt and I got a hat. Awesome winner right of the bat. LOL Well nobody else gives u crap and then they doubled your points after so many which was cool and I got $16 in free play sweet. Hope to get some comps in the mail cause would love to try to stay here and try it out didnt eat there though buffet was closed.

Reviews.Title: “Terribles was more than great”
Reviews.Author: Carrie M
Reviews.Content: Thanks for everything. Suite was perfect and I would recommend

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: yman l
Reviews.Content: nice clean room,great local people,lost some money and never offered a players card but its ok

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the $$ at Terrible's in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: J P
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in just about every hotel on the strip. We chose Terrible's this time frankly for the cost of the room during the convention that we were going for. The rooms are basic and nothing spectacular, but clean and orderly with a coffee pot and a flat screen t.v. Also beneath the flight path of Las Vegas International Airport which you quickly get over and I'm a super light sleeper. I love the buffett for the money - it rocks! The restaurant seems to take a while to get the food out, I've noticed this the last 2x I've been there, but the food is all good none the less. They have airport shuttle which is awesome, just make sure that they log you in, don't let hotel staff tell you - ok no problem, make them log you in and then it is no problem. It was nice to be off the strip as the taxi was able to jet around all the traffic issues and get us to our hotel real fast and we were good to go. If you wanna go to the strip, the shuttle will take you there to :-)

Reviews.Title: “terribles hotel and casino”
Reviews.Author: tinamc1953
Reviews.Content: we have been vistiting vegas for 10 years and played bingo in terribles and the slots, this time we stayed in terribles the rooms are basic but lets be honest you dont go to vegas to spend time in the rooms the beds are changed every day and the towels all spotless coffee machine etc are filled , the staff all reconize your face and are most pleasent the casino has just been taken over so we can look forward to a new revamped casino and buffet area now that does need attention please get rid of the plastic plates the food is nice enough for the price the cafe is good , and open 24/7 would stay there again the parking areas are safe and well lit up

Reviews.Title: “Terrible's Hotel & Casino”
Reviews.Author: DeniseJoseph
Reviews.Content: Hi all, just to let the world know of my wonderful experience I had at Terrible's Hotel & Casino recently. I play the slots all night long, I win a little, but the warm and friendly atmosphere at Terrible's is welcoming, safe and near to most shopping places. I really enjoy my stay, and looking forward to return to Terrible's Hotel & Casino soon. The staff is very helpful, also the security staff, I love you folks, you're the best!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible's is great for locals, but also visitors”
Reviews.Author: OCFoodDiva
Reviews.Content: I love Terrible's and don't let the name fool you. It's away from the strip so not a lot of touristy hustle and bustle. The environment is relaxed and the gaming staff is super nice. The Players Club is pretty good. I just found out that as long as you use your card in a 12 month period, your points last and don't expire. They have lots of slots to choose from. I'm a 50-hand video poker player and I normally play some video keno. But, they have some new slots like Batman based off of the Dark Knight movie and Ghostbusters. They are really fun and you get a lot of bonus rounds so you can interact with the machine. It's pretty cool. I sometimes find it's a bit smoky and the smokers seems to sit right next to me, but you'll get that any casino around town. We have stayed here many times in the past. The rooms aren't bad for the money. They usually run specials like $39/night.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: Elaena H
Reviews.Content: A very friendly and safe place to go to have fun even if you only have a few dollars to play. Employees are very nice and helpful and the food upstairs is terrific. A really good value these days. Promotions are great and fun.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible’s is just great”
Reviews.Author: mdurand
Reviews.Content: For a budget hotel Terrible’s is just great. The rooms were only $30 night and they are clean with comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for the price”
Reviews.Author: mockN
Reviews.Content: Had read all the reviews and was leery of staying here but the room was big and clean as was the bathroom. Room had a new large (LCD?) TV's. Shower/bath was small but had a seperate makeup/hair drying area. Check-in was quick and courteous as was the bell hop (same place) as we could not check in yet. Casino was small but very busy. Only down side was that lots of slot machines would not accept money or their printed tickets (had the lights on top blinking) and nobody was around to fix them. Did not eat the buffet but did eat at cafe across for it and the food was plentiful. Ate three times and the service was great twice and lousy once. I guess two of of three ain't bad.

Reviews.Title: “new owners tight slots”
Reviews.Author: utahteddybear
Reviews.Content: i doubt i will be back I like this place I had much better luck at Tuscany

Reviews.Title: “Surprise, surprise”
Reviews.Author: dennyr1217
Reviews.Content: After making several last minute changes for a trip to Las Vegas, we ended up booking a night at this hotel. We were plesantly surprised at the overall experience. The room, although old, was clean and spaceous. It had a huge flat screen TV, which probably isn't used much because, after all, this is Vegas. We had breakfast at the buffet in the Casino which, if you sign up for a player card, was only $3.99 and had a lot of variety. The hotel is only several blocks off of the Strip. This hotel is a good value. And the parking is free.

Reviews.Title: “Smaller casino and older property=Value&Personality”
Reviews.Author: chino53
Reviews.Content: The casino is small and as it gets later it gets quite smoky, but the video poker has good pays, the poker and craps tables are low limits and the dealers will get to know your name. There are 3 dollar crap tables during the day! The buffet upstairs for $5.99 lunch and $8.99 dinner had all you can eat shrimp and the food was fairly good but the real winner was the coffee shop. There are nightly 9 dollar specials which are excellant and include a full rack of baby back ribs or a new york strip steak. We had the ribs and split the meal which was more than enough for both of us. We stayed in a courtyard room and found the beds extremely comfortable and clean. The only drawbacks were the smaller bathrooms and the ugly carpet in the hallway outside. The pool was nice and pretty with tropical landscaping but unheated and too cold to swim in October, but you could use the hot tub until 10 pm.

Reviews.Title: “could be better”
Reviews.Author: pritchardp6
Reviews.Content: Stayed one nite Nov/2011. Casino floor has smell of stale smoke, Checkin staff were glum but helpful and efficient. Room was clean and good size, didn't like ground floor adjacent to parking lot, lack of privacy. Room was fairly quiet. Decor all through casino and hotel is dated. Staff at cafe were pleasent and food was good and plentyful. Rate was very good for being their during major convention and being so close to convention center. Would consider stay there again, thanks for pleasant trip

Reviews.Title: “Good Night”
Reviews.Author: Barblikestotravel
Reviews.Content: Had a few good nights sleep on a comfortable bed in this well priced, off Strip hotel. They have a well lit parking lot and parking garage, or, if you choose to drive 1 mile to the strip instead of walk, park in Bill's garage on the corner of Flamingo and LVB for free. The 2nd best thing about this Terrible's location is it's proximity to the airport, no fuss no muss. The $3.99 (w/Players Card) breakfast buffet is well worth it from the hot foods to the fruit. Next to the buffett is the cafe where I had a delicous soup w/ whole wheat dinner rolls. Good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Fun & Good Food”
Reviews.Author: billyt47
Reviews.Content: Comfortable rooms, reasonable priced, away from the hustle & bustle of the strip

Reviews.Title: “It's small and local, but still fun.”
Reviews.Author: Beachlvr77
Reviews.Content: I didn't stay in the hotel, but did stop by to play the slot machines. It's much smaller, and easier to find your way around. People who live here love it, and their dinner is really reasonable and I heard it was good. Sign up for a rewards card and get a t-shirt. Hey, it's free. Can't speak for the rooms, but it's a good change of pace from casinos on the strip for a little break!

Reviews.Title: “Good alternative to the strip”
Reviews.Author: BobWashingtonMo
Reviews.Content: If you have spent enough time on the strip, this is a good alternative. Clean room, good service. Not part of a herd of people. A great value. The restuatant is a good place for an inexpensive good meal. When our TV had a problem, maintenace was up to quickly resolve the issue.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: madog31
Reviews.Content: This is NOT a luxury or glitzy strip hotel. It is old casino /hotel for people who don't want to spend a lot of money. My room was very large and fine. The swimming pool area is lovely, BUT the pool is NOT heated. I don't really gamble but I enjoyed placing a few sports bets. The food at the buffet is about on par with a cafeteria and the restaurant is like a diner. I would not go there to eat but there are a lot of places nearby. If you want to go to the strip the walk is 20 minutes so if you really want to be on the strip most of the time, this is not the place for you. Little line at check in and personal where nice.

Reviews.Title: “Best bang for your buck in Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: wirelessguy2011
Reviews.Content: I got reservations on the busiest weekend in October and avg. less than $70 per night. I expected the worst but got an extremely friendly staff and big room overlooking the pool. Not to mention the buffet was very good with a great selection and under $10. I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Vegas and not wanting to spend a lot for something you spend so little time in. Make sure to take advantage of the Free shuttle to and from the airport and the strip. I don't remember the guy's name but he was extremely helpful and knowledgeable about where and when things were going on that weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas on a beer budget”
Reviews.Author: Rottten
Reviews.Content: Without having read any of the other reviews, here's my take. This was my 3rd visit to Terribles in the last year and a half. (May 2010, July 2011 & Sept 2011.) If you like to do things on the cheap, generally don't sweat the small stuff, or expect the swankiness of other Vegas hotels, it's the way to go. The beds are very comfy. Rooms are unspectacular but clean. Pool is small but very pleasant and nice to lounge around. Good enough for me. The buffet is, again, unspectacular, but decent. (Notice a theme here?) I didn't even visit the buffet this last trip. I prefer the Bougainvillea Café next door. The portions are large, tasty, the prices very reasonable, and the menu offers a wide variety of items. Due to the low cost the clientele isn't what you'll see at the nicer hotels. It's an older and lower income type crowd. But if you rather enjoy the more "colourful" type of people . . . I've never stayed in the tower. Just in the 3 floor horseshoe shaped part of the hotel. One plus is you won't be waiting for elevators like you get at the ginormous hotels. (Only for it to show up full.) Other positives are: The 24-hour store is very handy. Much better booze prices than you'll get at hotels on the strip. Free parking if you're renting a car. Free WiFi. Pool area is nicely treed, with areas to make both sun worshippers and albino's content. Negatives would be. Worn and dirty carpets in the hallways. TV only gets a half dozen channels. (But is a 42" LCD.) Casino area is smokier than some of the finer establishments. Can only assume is due to an older ventilation system. If you're not renting a car, things could be a good hike away for you. It comes down to what you're looking for. If you love the glitz and glamour. Like the feeling of being treated like a millionaire and hobnobbing with the beautiful people. Don't go to Terribles. If you're willing to overlook minor deficiencies, and the fact a high percentage of patrons are missing body parts, to save a few bucks. I really do recommend checking it out. I'll be back for sure. The only thing that really sucks is the name of the place. "You're staying where?!" Hints: One Friday night there was a long line of people out front that had been waiting for cabs for awhile. I walked across the street to the gas station and flagged one down in under a two minutes. Make sure you actually pull shut the room door behind you as you leave. I've found on more than just one room that if you just let it swing closed it won't actually close and lock. As an aside, car rentals in Vegas can be cheap if done right. I paid $160 (taxes in) for the week. Terribles isn't for everyone. But it's good enough for me and my beer budget. Cheers.

Reviews.Title: “The only thing Terrible is the name!”
Reviews.Author: okpeden
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great and has everything you need! It you want a shuttle you have to call an hr. beforehand. Get a cab if you don't want to wait or call from the plane... The resturant was cheap and fun! I have had better food but I have had worse!

Reviews.Title: “Good off-the-strip accommodation”
Reviews.Author: waywright
Reviews.Content: The most important features were the free wifi and free airport shuttle. The staff were always available and helpful. No fine dining but good reliable food in the restaurant and acceptable food at the buffet. We were given a 'quiet' area room which we discovered was also used by at least 2 airlines - good endorsement. The 15 minute walk to the Strip was a 'plus' for us.

Reviews.Title: “Aptly Named Hotel”
Reviews.Author: boomersooner5154
Reviews.Content: Expedia price: $60. At the front desk: $32. Smoky walk through casino. Carpet dirty. Beds good. No advantage other than wi-fi. Stayed at Bill's on return trip for $45.

Reviews.Title: “Gross and Groovy”
Reviews.Author: margalow
Reviews.Content: OK, First...what's NOT Terrible at Terribles: The pool and hot tub were actually crystal clear and had lots of clean towels (a must for us). The food was cheap. Not fancy, but for breakfast we had champagne, and an excellent brisket. The jelly roll was very good. It will fill you up. Ummm, what else....I'm thinking....the locals hang out there. They are colorful, friendly, and a total hoot. The slots were loose. The gift shop had affordable liquor and junk. PF Chang's was across the street and we actually walked to the strip. It wasn't a short walk. Luckily, we love to walk. Now for the Terrible...ahhh, the aroma. My suitcase is still on the back porch coughing. Good thing we had a "non-smoking" room! LOL. The room was ummm, different. Cllllassssy. I think they tried to clean it. But, hey...it WAS cheap. If you are really broke...then I would say it's OK. Maybe I'm naive but we never felt too scared.

Reviews.Title: “Cockroaches!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Froggitt
Reviews.Content: Roaches in the bathroom. No offer to move me to different room, instead sent man with insecticide, which then smelt for the rest of the stay there. He removed the bodies. Need a car to get anywhere sensible. Buffet was cheap but not good. I guess you get what you pay for. Free wifi was the only real positive......plus they printed my boarding card for me. All the hotel and casino staff I encountered were miserable apart from one dealer (Elanie or Elaine). Fourth visit to Vegas......the only hotel I wouldnt go back to.

Reviews.Title: “Uh,, no thanks”
Reviews.Author: minesbigger
Reviews.Content: We were supposed to get an "updated tower room"... We ended up with a first floor room, complete with a view of the back parking area where the employees (and others) waited for the shuttle. If you stay here, ask to see your room first!!

Reviews.Title: “bingo we love it”
Reviews.Author: whitey17
Reviews.Content: i stayed at terribles once hated the room and hated the casino late at night didnt always feel safe but the bingo room is second to none ive been to las vegas 23 in the last 8yrs and this is where i go the locals are fantastic made some real good friend the staff are outstanding take time out to have a chat with everyone and make you feel very welcome,there's some great prize money to be be played for and won i have won 3 good amounts whist playing here(uk people take id with you in case you win big)the slots seem to be very loose and the cocktail waitress are always around this is a great place to be during the day at night it fills up with alot of young mexican men who arn't very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: warriorbard
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Vegas and I wanted it to be a memorable stay and I'm happy to say that I lucked out with this hotel. Terrible's is a fantastic hotel that's away from the crowd and noise of the Strip. The location is rather good; there's a bus stop directly in front of it and a gas station across the street with a convenience store. Bus 202 will stop directly outside Caesar's Palace though it's frequency is only every 20-30 minutes. You may attempt to walk to the Strip but as I quickly found out, walking for 15-20 minutes in 110 degree heat is not so pleasant. It is walkable though, but I would only recommend doing so when the weather is cooler. The rooms were a nice surprise. It was spacious and rather classy. Mine was tastefully decorated with soft lighting and a rather large TV. I didn't like the fact that my room overlooked the parking lot but it was actually quiet and safe. The bathroom was rather cramped but usable. Staff were courteous even though they looked a little stoic. I checked in quickly with no problems. Their 24 hour cafe has a nice selection of foods that cater to various palates. i didn't get a chance to try out their breakfast buffet but that was due to the fact that I only had 5 days in Vegas and was eager to explore the city. Overall, this hotel is very much recommended. It's not teeming with tourists and it's tidy and quiet. There's free, fast wi-fi in the rooms and a free shuttle to and from the airport. The room rates are decent and affordable and you get more than your money's worth with Terrible's. I would stay here again; I really liked this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I liked it”
Reviews.Author: thrigby
Reviews.Content: Cheap £67 for three nights. Nice size room, big telly but not much choice of chanels, lovely pool, cheap gift shop with cheap drinks. Join the free membrship club for free t shirt and reduced buffet food. Liked breakfast, never had chicken for breakfast before. Nice staff. Bit of a trek to the sritp in the heat. I got a bus couple of times, was OK. Free wifi, Free shuttle to and from the aiport. Some 'interesting'' people hang around the hotel but thats Vegas, I had no problems. enjoyed it

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service at the cafe”
Reviews.Author: Dianne C
Reviews.Content: The waitress at the cafe in Terribles was very rude. Many people were leaving before they received their food because she was so mean. I heard her say good when one man left.

Reviews.Title: “Would look for a better stay, but the rooms where nice.”
Reviews.Author: kara b
Reviews.Content: We unfortunatly had to stay in the smoking section of the hotel area, it didnt smell like smoke thankfully. The room was nice, the view was of the courtyard which seemed nice as well. The beds were comfortable. We however didnt feel comfortable being in a hotel that took like 5 min to walk to the room which didnt seem safe at night. we couldnt sleep well at all, our neighbors were so loud it was as if they were in our very room, it seemed like the walls were to thin, my cousin needed to use the phone and went out but an officer told her that she had to talk on the phone inside the room. I thought this was a little odd. overall i would stay if i had to , but i would like something closer to the stripl. It was a free night so, cant complain to much.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Off Strip Hotel”
Reviews.Author: henulj-lse
Reviews.Content: This is an older property and that can't be hidden. The bathroom is very small with very low shower head. If you have a problem with a machine in the casino, it takes forever for a service tech to show up. I had my elderly mother with me and there were some strange locals hitting her up for cash. We have taught her how to get rid of them, but the worst one threatened her that God would punish her for not giving her $. So perhaps security could be better? There are new flat screens in the rooms but there are only a few channels on the tv. We were on the first floor so the outside noise was easily heard through the closed windows and the hallway noise was coming in under the door. The room was clean and the beds were comfy. Parking was easy even if we couldn't find a handicapped parking space. The front desk is smack dab in the middle of the casino with no enclosure. We booked on Hotels.com and the dates were wrong in the casino system, but they were able to change the dates and get us in. Luckily I had a copy of my reservation confirmation showing the dates I booked. We only ate at the restaurant once and it was adequate. We had the best luck gambling at this casino. Would we return? Likely, but not anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: “So much more for your money!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: skeezicks_02889
Reviews.Content: Older Casino....Hotel room was clean and spacious...Pool was nice..Cafe and Buffet were like the "old time Las Vegas" Great food,large portions..Slots were loose!!!! We loved this place!! Once you get over the glitz and glamour of the Strip. Come here! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome value for the price”
Reviews.Author: emilyjoy
Reviews.Content: Nice room, comfortable beds, nice small pool area with shady spots. Coffee and a Krispy Kreme donut for $1 in the gift shop. Other great prices for essentials there. The casino area is horribly smokey and pretty gross. BUT, for the price of the room- stay here and drive to the strip! Spend your money on dinner instead!

Reviews.Title: “we always enjoy a night here if you are looking for a good deal this is it”
Reviews.Author: diost
Reviews.Content: Terribles is off-strip but they do offer a very good shuttle service to and from the airport - twice an hour. This is a comfortable well used hotel but we have had no issues with monthly vists in the last 2 years. It has free wifi in the rooms - no extra charge. Breakfast buffet is currently $2.99 - try and beat that - watch for the buy one buffet get one free coupon ad in tourist info areas. The casino is quite small and does get busy. A new coupon book in the room is worth checking out - this month it gave a free house drink , $9 worth of free slot pull just take the coupon book down to the players club to get vouchers - to get the offers early or late is better as the club desk gets busy!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, nothing fancy but worth the price”
Reviews.Author: AcmeRon
Reviews.Content: Nice off-strip casino, not flashy but comfortable and not crowded like the strip. Buffets were ok, again, nothing flashy but good food. Cafe seemed to have some issues. Some food was very good but I also had the worst t-bone I have ever had. Staff didn't seem to care about it. They have a nice pool. They also have a "convenience store' which was great to get a coffee and a donut or a pop or whatever.

Reviews.Title: “A great value!!”
Reviews.Author: cjerseym
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after our flight and right before driving to the Grand Canyon. We arrived late (2 am our time!) so needless to say, all I wanted was a clean quiet room - and I got it! It was so easy to find, easy to park. The casino was kind of dark and smoky (but isn't that true of most casinos??) but the check in was easy and the staff was pleasant. The casino is not huge, so it was an easy walk to find the room. I was pleasantly surprised - the room was clean and big. It overlooked the pool - which we enjoyed briefly the next morning, for a little sunbathing before our drive to Arizona. The pool had nice lounge chairs and towels. There was also a convenience store right near the pool and casino with cheap snacks, coffee, and soda - something you don't find at the fancy strip casinos where a bottle of water costs 3 bucks at the pool! It was honestly great and I would definitely stay there again - it was only $26!!!!!!!!!! Honestly, a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Away from the noise, good price and quality”
Reviews.Author: Felixrs
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a couple of night in this hotel. The name doesn't sound very good, but the hotel will offer you everything you need for a visit to LV. Room was very spacious and clean, with nice views to the swimming pool. Beds were comfortable, and the bathroom was clean and big. The hotel is just a couple of blocks from the Strip (the main road where most fancy hotels are located), away enough from it to sleep without noise, and close enough to reach all places quickly. We didn't use at all the casino from the entrance, we just wanted one place to sleep and from where to visit other things. Parking is free, as everywhere in LV, that's why we think it's a good choice for people travelling with a car. The hotel's buffet is cheap and there are many things to pick. The quality was average. Before staying in the Terrible's hotel we were for one night in the Circus Circus hotel. We preferred Terrible's.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: jazzmine615
Reviews.Content: Loved this place. They provide a hotel shuttle for free, the rooms are clean, the casino is nice and large, they are very friendly, and it is a 1 mile walk to the strip or a short taxi ride. There is also a city bus, although we didn't use it. We liked it so much we even came back to stay again at the end of the same trip.

Reviews.Title: “This is for the restaurant only!!”
Reviews.Author: figboo69
Reviews.Content: I heard the buffet here was great.. was staying up the street and it was within walking distance. Actually went in the wee hours after clubbing and the damn buffet was not open. So I figured well we are already here and the food on the buffet comes from the same kitchen.. so we should've been safe right? NOT................ I got some kind of mystery meat as a steak.... People (when you cant tell the preparation method) RUN.... I normally ask for my eggs to be prepared scrambled soft... this time they came to me that way... which I should've known was an issue... but honestly when your tipsy and sleepy... but know you need to eat... you just do.. WELL I WISHED I WOULD'VE RAN. The bubble guts and diarrhea I got the next day wasn't worth it! Maybe the buffet is the bomb, but if so, they must have different cooks, a different kitchen or BOTH....

Reviews.Title: “A Terribles return”
Reviews.Author: redfan
Reviews.Content: Just back home from our bi-annual trip to Las Vegas staying at our favourite hotel ,no not the biggest ,smartest,newest or swishest.Just the friendliest comfiest ,most convienient.best value off strip little gem in Vegas by a country mile.We are always made to feel most welcome,get the room we request and always have a great stay.All of the hotel and casino and cafe/buffet staff are great ,of course there is always the odd exception but don't tell me you don't get that in the high end bracket either,everbody has a bad day now and then.Tell me the last time you stayed at one of the large strip hotels and got recognised as a returning customer ,i'll bet the occasions are few and far between,unless of cousre you are mr/mrs high roller.We are recognised by most staff and it just makes the whole trip a bit more personal.Also a big thank you goes to Kirsten at Terribles a very helpful lady.In closing if you haven't been to Terribles yet give it your consideration, read other reviews, but at the end of the day if you don't give it a shot you wont know what your missing.Also some people complain the place is full of locals.but in my humble opinion when you are abroad on vacation you usually find the best places to stay and eat are the ones frequented by the locals because the locals know the best places.

Reviews.Title: “somewhat satisfied”
Reviews.Author: ghost029
Reviews.Content: depite the reviews I read, we decided to stay there for two nights. Room was nice and clean, beds were comfortable, and internet was free and worked great. Room also had a big flat screen tv that worked great as well. However, most staff and management we encountered were very unfriendly.it was almost like they made you feel unimportant. I would suggest to stay away from the buffet, as the food selection is poor and the food quailaty was terrible. The restaurant, on-the-other-hand, had great frood, genourous portions, and good prices. I enjoed the 9.99 t-bone steak dinner. However, no matter what time of day we went to eat. we had to wait a long time for our food. so prepare to wait. A few times we almost walked out casue we were tired of waiting. I would suggest to sign up for the players club, if you go to the gift shop you can use it for a discount. We parked the car in the parking lot and felt like we had to check on it every day;but there was no problem with it. I think, if it would have been any longer than a two day stay I would have stayed somewhere else. overall, I think I would stay there again, simply for the cheap price.

Reviews.Title: “BACK AGAIN FOR A REAL BARGAIN AND VALUE”
Reviews.Author: muscletongue3000
Reviews.Content: was here in feburary 2011 and am now back for another week. hotel used by us airways for their crews hotel is served by RTC transit system - convenient and easy to use - great value had room in tower this time on fourth floor overlooking pool locals come into hotel to take home steak dinner at $9.99 cafe only too willing to supply you with a doggy bag for their extra large portions casino patronized by locals as slots are loose!!!!! convenient transfers to and from airport great convenience store off lobby for newspapers, smokes, liquor, drinks and snack

Reviews.Title: “Terrible's was just the opposite!”
Reviews.Author: Bahama06
Reviews.Content: We needed a room in Las Vegas for one night and since we were arriving late from Boston we wanted a very inexpensive room. On our wish list was a property that had a casino (can't arrive in Las Vegas and not play a few slots, regardless of the time) clean rooms, comfortable beds, easy parking, and not to far away from the airport. Terribles fit the bill!!! Needless to say we were very concerned on what we would get for our AARP rate of $34 but we were pleasantly surprised and would stay there again, no problem!!

Reviews.Title: “Terribly surprised at terrific night's stay”
Reviews.Author: Underdog_SPP
Reviews.Content: After telephoning a Las Vegas Motel 6 location and finding they couldn't guarantee the price I would pay because they didn't know if my discount would apply to me, and sounding iffy on the price - a real first I've had with Motel 6 (check my recent reviews), I checked into what the Internet might say would be a good situation for my lodging needs. Since this was a Sunday through Thursday lodging situation, I knew I would get a better deal than the Friday/Saturday weekend traveler. So I went to good old tripadvisor to see what my fellow travelers were saying. In my offpeak lodging situation, I found Terrible's to be terrific. No gaming fee like a lot of the other properties charge, reasonable rates in line with - gasp! - Motel 6, and with better rooms than any Motel 6 could ever offer. I came to the front desk and told them what rate I would get if I booked with Hotels.com. They said they could not match that rate. I asked the clerk if they would be willing to drop their rate since I had the information and the technology available to me to get the rate I desired from Hotels.com. They declined - no harm, no foul. No problem - I merely walked back to my car for a private conversation with the Hotels.com customer service representative, and came back inside to the same desk clerk with the authorization number Hotels.com gave me. Of course, the number was not of use to Terrible's staff, and the reservation was not on their information system just yet. No problem. . . time for a little walk (it was early in the afternoon) and check out the corridors and rooms, and check out the elevators as to location. That done, I came back in a half hour's time to the front desk for the third time. This time the clerk (different one) saw I had a confirmed reservation in their system courtesy of Hotels.com. Good deal. It's so wonderful living in this Information Age, eh? (wink) I asked for quiet for a good night's rest and they put me on the third floor on the southeast corner area furthest from the casino floor. The elevators, by the way, are located at each corner where each inner hallway bisects the next hallway. These interior hallway elevators are also next to a bronze colored half circle trash can/cigarette ashcan. Yes, the doors are painted the same beige color as the guest rooms, but if one knows they are at the corners, it becomes fairly easy to locate them. The room was quite large. I had two queen beds, with a large flat screen television having basic cable channel lineup. Other pay to view programming and kid's electronic games were available at extra cost if desired, which I did not use. The mattress proved to be quite firm, a real plus. Pillows were large, fluffy and super comfortable. One was quite enough for me. Wow! The bathroom is very tastefully done in beige and rose colors, and there is ceramic tile for the bathroom floor. The sink has a very large mirror and has a coffeemaker for two servings of coffee, which I also didn't use, since I don't drink coffee. The ice container has both a bag and a lid, a plus. Free ice is available in the second and third floors in the southeast corners, which was close by to my room, and at the gift shop on the first floor. Ironing board and Iron are in each room. No microwave or refrigerator in standard rooms, though. For these one must get the upgraded room at extra cost. The dials for operating the heating and air conditioning system are not distinct, and so I made the mistake of setting the air conditioner to a higher than desired temperature level on the thermostat control knob. This resulted in me waking up in the middle of the night in a stuffy room (you cannot open the windows). Not to worry. . . I called the front desk and had the maintainance technician come to my room. I got a knock on my door in about one minute. He set the thermostat to the correct position, and all was well. I slumbered back to sleep, and enjoyed a good night's rest despite my mistake in operating the air conditioning system. Regarding safety: like all Las Vegas establishments of this type, there is security, and of course they patrol the parking lots. After 6:00 PM, the outside doors to the rooms away from the casino have locks so that only guests with a valid room card key may enter in. Of course someone with a valid card may allow others to enter in with them, etc. but a good thing I suppose to help keep out riffraff. Security cameras (or fakes) are installed at the entrances to the hallways. I felt safe in my room, but I did look out the window to check on my car and the parking lot below. . . but that's just me. This being Las Vegas, of course there were people dressed up to go to parties, etc. Did I see anything I don't normally see? Certainly. Would I regard my stay as family friendly? Because I minimized my time in the hallways, elevators, and *ahem* the casino, I would give a qualified yes. One doesn't really see children in a place like this - I didn't - , but by taking the kind of action I have described above, one can stay here with children if that's what you have to do. If I were with children, I would go to a place like Boulder City that doesn't have the casino element to it, though. Finally, an historical note: this property was known as the Continental Hotel and Casino in the mid 1990's. Not sure when Terrible's took it over and renovated it, but it sure looks a lot better - and is getting far more business - than the decrepit and moribund Continental, which eventually had to declare bankruptcy. Nice to see some successful turnarounds in the hospitality industry, as the old Continental was quite the dive when I first became acquainted with it years ago.

Reviews.Title: “Unprofessional”
Reviews.Author: Henry154914
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in Feb. and March. Pleasantly supprised. Only drawback was that while parked in parkade a substance dripped down on our Black vehicle from some white pipes above and caused spotting to the hood, door and fender. I contacted Mike in engineering who called back to say they would investgate. Never did get a response after although I called back numerous times. I have since taken my vehicle to a proffesional who managed to buff out the stains. Cost $200.00. So be careful where you park. Because of their lack of interest in my problem and not dealing with it I will be spending my gambling and accomodation dollars elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad but hated going through smoky lobby and first floor”
Reviews.Author: TravelerGEO
Reviews.Content: We had hiking plans in the desert, so our stay was strictly for an overnight after our plane ride and then again on our trip home. The location could not be any better if you are coming and going via the airport. About a 2 to 3 mile drive to the airport and the airport rent a car terminal. The room were great for the price. Our complaint was that we booked through a travel site and wanted a roll away bed which cannot be done unless you have a king because of fire codes. The hotel was helpful in that they gave us extra pillows and blankets for a makeshift bed on the floor. We stayed on the 2nd floor which was non-smoking but had to travel through the smoky lobby/casino and through the smoking first floor to get to our room. This was my biggest complain. I would stay here again if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Terribles is actually Great!”
Reviews.Author: LucasBilliards
Reviews.Content: I stayed there in February while in was in town for my brothers bachelor party. I was pleasantly surprised, I was skeptical like everyone else is with a name like Terribles, but I couldn't have been more pleased. It was the cheapest place I could find anywhere. The rooms are pretty big and clean. It has a 42 inch plasma TV which I admit I watched like 5 minutes the whole trip, but nice to have. The bathroom was a little small but it serves it's purpose just fine. It is an older hotel that's isn't as nice as the super resorts on the strip but you can't beat the deal. If you're like me and just need a clean room to shower and sleep in between boozing and partying Terribles is perfect. The check in and out was the easiest I've encountered at any hotel, and the hotel staff was great. When we checked in we asked for an iron and ironing board and by the time we got to the room it was already there. The restaurant upstairs is open 24/7 and is actually pretty good, I had the ribs, mmmmm. It is probably too far to walk back and forth to the strip but we had a rental car so we just drove right down Flamingo and parked at Bills. Took 2 minutes in the car and was actually better anyways, who wants to walk back to the hotel after a long day of walking everywhere anyway? I actually enjoyed being off the strip, it was way quieter and way cheaper. There are alot of restaurants in the area which is good too. The convenience store they have in the casino is perfect too, cheap with everything you need. Didn't gamble here so really can't speak on it but it's ok, has a bunch of slots, a few tables, bingo, and a sports book. Parking was easy and right outside my window. I actually liked the place so much I booked it again for a trip next week with my wife. Same great deal so I'm happy. Can't wait to get back and have some fun. Stay here! Take my word, you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: kupa
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the "old" section of the hotel.. I think it must have been the original structure and the casino was added on. The inside rooms face a central open patio, very nicely landscaped. Our room was very nice for the price, and quiet. The only complaint I would have is that the elevators are hard to find! The doors look very much like the room doors, so you have to pay attention. We skipped the buffet, which appears to be popular (based on the line we saw). Dinner in the dining room was quite good & very reasonably priced. We had prime rib on the daily special for $9.95. Just don't try to order a drink before dinner.. they seem to be unable to integrate that with a dinner order. We had the dinner start to arrive before the cocktail waitress even showed up, so when she did we cancelled the cocktail.

Reviews.Title: “When Terrible is Really Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Johnnyblackjack
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Terrible's Hotel and Casino for four nights and I was really impressed. I've stayed at approximately 10 different hotels in Vegas over the past four years at all levels from the ritziest to the cheapest and dollar for dollar this was the best. It is not a luxury hotel by any means, but at only $27 a night by far and away the best deal. The rooms are regular size with a large flat screen TV. There were only a limited number of channels, but if you're in Vegas to watch TV you need to have you're head examined. Anyway, the rooms were very clean and well maintained. Surprisingly, the beds, pillows and sheets were very high standard. The bed was one of the most comfortable I've had in Vegas. The bathroom was small but adequate. Housekeeping was very efficient and the rest of the staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel had a nice small pool with some landscaping and lots of palm trees. Kind of like a miniature version of the pool at the Flamingo. The hotel does not have the dreaded "resort fee" that many hotels have, yet it had the extra's that these fees provide. This included free in room wi fi and free use of a small but adequately equipped exercise room. The casino was small but they had good blackjack rules. I did not eat at the buffet; I took a look at it and it didn't look very appetizing so I'm not sure I would recommend it. I did eat at the coffee shop and it was okay. In summary, I highly recommend Terrible's for people looking for a nice hotel who aren't interested in staying a mega resort/hotel, yet want to be close to the strip (a 15 minute walk) and want to save their money so they can lose it gambling. I found the $27 rate at their web page.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: Deserttrends
Reviews.Content: Staying here five nights for a conference at the MGM. The good: very easy to find parking, the room are a good size and reasonably clean. The bad: the casino is the saddest I have ever seen. Full of smoke and the morbidly obese, I ran thru to get out to the car and probably have lung cancer. The lighting here is terrible. The walls in the hotel rooms are paper thin- I can hear every word of our neighbors as well as everyone who walks by the room. When someone nearby shuts their door, the walls shake.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: urbanite1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Terrible's (for the second time) when visiting my son in LV. Not a glam place, but it has great beds and pillows. We stayed on the 3rd floor and it was very clean and quiet. Small casino is ok (just stay out of the way when bingo lets out), food is ok. We misunderstood the internet special and thought we would get free breakfast buffet each day --- when checking out, they gave it to us - a nice touch. We definitely will stay here again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “The Good and The Bad”
Reviews.Author: QenTerra
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a few times over the last two years as often I find a great price through one of the online sites.
