(This visit I booked through Tripres at $19.95 per night) The rooms I stayed in ranged from fair to very good condition. The beds I found to be comfortable. The free internet is fine for web browsing but it usually takes over 2 hours to download a movie. Last year the buffet was not so good. My stay in Jan of this showed much improvement In the buffet so I would grade it as good. Slot play here is tough. There are loser slots available at other locations. They have a shop with very good prices for a casino. What I like best and brings me back is the pool and hot tub. The pool area is nicely landscaped and the hot tub seems to be open year round. In this price range I would give the pool / spa an excellent rating. A little tip for booking online. The best price points seem to be for a 3 or 4 night stay (sometimes you will see a buy a night get one free also) about 2 weeks in advance so you can save a few bucks by playing with the dates and breaking your stay into segments.

Reviews.Title: “Not at all terrible...”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug1346
Reviews.Content: My wife and I wanted to find a cheap stay in Vegas. We didn't have much of a travel budget but needed to get away. Free airport shuttle, just give the hotel a call when you arrive, saved $30 bucks cha ching! When you arrive, join the Player's Club. It's free to join and you get free and discounted stuff, like a $2.99 breakfast, cha ching! Pancakes, eggs and sausage, and it's good! Free T-shirts, free drink coupons, half-priced meals (although I wouldn't recommend the buffet). The room was basic but comfortable and clean. Flat screen TV was okay - need more channels. Cleaning staff was helpful, quick with clean towels. Frequented by locals and it's a layover spot for airline flight crews. Its about 1 mile and a half from the strip, but a nice walk if you're in shape! Never felt unsafe even while walking late at night. About halfway to the strip found a diamond in the rough - Ellis Island. BEST CHEAP FOOD IN VEGAS, BOOM ! ! ! ! ! It's a hole in the wall "local" casino, but Steak, potato, soup, salad, with a 32 oz. beer from their micro brewery - $7.99 (not on the menu, you have to ask for it), Shrimp dinner $6.99, cha ching! We had a terribly great time!

Reviews.Title: “We got the most bang for our buck.”
Reviews.Author: RoninPueblo
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here for the last four or five years. We have always been very satisfied with the room, food and staff is excellent. They all go out of there way to make you comfortable. We consider this a ma and pa type Hotel and casino. We feel very at home here which is niece for a working couple. When we go to the big casinos we just feel way out of our league. For no more time than we spend in our room this casino is fine with us. Everything is reasonable here, Rooms, Food and the gambling is great.

Reviews.Title: “Dont Stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: dontstay_11
Reviews.Content: Choose another casino like circus, this casino is under receivership and is poorly managed, someone else owns the restaurants and will not honor casino coupons even though they put them on your bed. Called 2 weeks in advance and paid for room, when I arrived my room was not available even though I told them I was disabled and needed a room on the ground floor! I went to front desk and asked that the manager call me to discuss problem I guess he is to important to talk with commoners!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lancashirebob47
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this small friendly hotel many times. The staff are great and nothing is too much trouble. Free transportation from the airport is a bonus. Pool area is private and provides plenty of shade. On the occasions I have been there, it was never ever very busy around the pool, again another bonus, Plenty of sunbeds and clean towels. I always stay in the newer tower rooms but have stayed in the standard rooms previously, but just prefer the tower. The bus stops right outside the hotel to take you up to the strip, or it is a good 15 minute walk. My only criticism would be to say the food in not the best in either the buffet or restaurant but the prices are good. However for anyone who likes chinese there is a brilliant chinese bistro just across the road called P.F.Changs, really fab food and good prices. For Italian food there is The Olive Garden just down the road , and a steakhouse and other restaurants over the road from Terribles, so no need to go hungry. Please give this hotel a try, it is a little GEM, if you like small and friendly without the overpriced hotels on the strip and be sure to take a chocolate bar of mint AERO for my friend COLE ( now Manager) on the check-in desk, it will make his day.

Reviews.Title: “Good cheap option”
Reviews.Author: sukhoi_584th
Reviews.Content: Had a problem with check-in when we arrived just after the airport shuttle showed up. There was only one person working the desk for a while, and we had to wait about 15 minutes to check-in which is pretty frustrating. Other than that it's a great cheap option in Las Vegas. The rooms were more of a $60-$75 hotel quality, but we only paid something like $34 total. It wasn't spotless, but was clean enough.

Reviews.Title: “Not clean but cheap”
Reviews.Author: simpson100
Reviews.Content: Only paid $40 to stay there so I can't complain much. Hallway carpet is dirty, there was a big disgusting stain on the chair in the room, and the shower head was shot. But nice casino with cheap food.

Reviews.Title: “If you want the basics ... this is it.”
Reviews.Author: ZorroAca
Reviews.Content: Was not in Vegas for the thrills. Needed a place to lay my head and didn't want to pay the dough. Good points - free shuttle from the airport, free parking, internet connection, very good price, ok rooms, no hidden resort fee at the end. Down side - caters to the walking zombies, bad part of town at night, no romantic feeling at all. Suggestion ... stay on the 3rd floor (top) if possible because at night you can hear the people walking around above your room. And this review is for the cheap part of the hotel ... I can't speak for the tower which they say is better. But you still have the walking zombies. There's a question here "would you recommend this hotel to a friend" yes I would ... if he was tough and knew what he was getting into ... then it's a pretty good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable hotel, pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: coloradojentravels
Reviews.Content: Terribles is the affordable off the strip choice. They have airport shuttle service included, cheap eats and a nice staff. If you dont have transportation and want to get to the strip, the bus picks up/dropsoff right out front. Its a great place to stay if you are on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Price was Right”
Reviews.Author: Auntie_Pooks
Reviews.Content: Terribles is a non-trendy, budget-friendly hotel. It is about a mile off the strip, but bus service is easily accessible. I found the rooms very basic, but clean. The food at the cafe was priced right and tasty. The pool area was very clean and relaxing with a lot of shade, although the water temperature was on the cool side.Tthe staff was very friendly and helpful. The free shuttle from the airport was awesome! I would most definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best cheap hotel in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: HotelFan77
Reviews.Content: Ignore the haters - Terrible's is a great budget casino hotel, with good service and location. I was here on business for a conference at UNLV. The conference was about a 20 minute walk, but so was the official conference hotel, and this was half the price. The casino was smoky, but not overwhelmingly so, and the room was clean and comfortable. The bed was new and it had a flat screen. One good thing was that the windows actually opened. Since it was October and cool out, this was quite nice. The cafe was good and cheap, and they had 24 room service, which was also quite inexpensive. 30 minutes or less, and none of those expensive "service" charges. Also an on-site convenience store had snacks and cheap drinks and beer. The pool was cold, but it was October, but the hot tube was nice, and the pool area was a great place to sit and socialize. The casino was mostly slots, but the tables were quite cheap - lots of $5 blackjack the weekend I was there. There was well run shuttle to the airport. Overall, the service was very good. I asked for an iron and extra lamp for my room, and they were delivered promptly, and everyone in the casino and restaurants were efficient and friendly. Location is "off strip" but it's walking distance to the Hard Rock, Hofbrauhaus, and a number of other restaurants, and a quick cab ride to the strip. If you are looking for a place to "see and be seen", Terribles is not it. If you want a clean, comfortable room at a rock bottom rate, with all of the casino hotel basics, then Terrible's is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay there”
Reviews.Author: Zimneyj
Reviews.Content: Service was bad,the shower was horrible,the pool was ice cold.How they did that I will never figure out.Food took forever to get to the table.People were very rude I will never stay there again

Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: carolinasangel
Reviews.Content: As our quick gettaway spot. Its the best... Inexpensive not formal FUN FUN slots and great tables with fabulous dealers..

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE'S IS TERRIFIC”
Reviews.Author: megabill
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at Terrible's and had a great time. I had prearranged for paid transportation to the hotel but it never showed up. I called Terrible's and they sent a free shuttle to pick me up in ten minutes. The shuttle driver gave me a couple of vegas happenings magazines and a ticket to a strip magic show. The check-in was fast and the desk person met all my requests, non-smoking, king size bed, refrigerator, and on the first floor or near an elevator. The room was much bigger than I expected. It was in the older part of the hotel but was very clean and fresh smelling. It had a 42" flat screen TV mounted on the wall. I really liked the coffee maker in the room. I was able to get all my meals compted with my rate of play. Their generous point system with the club card added up so I was also able to bring home a number of souveniers from the gift shop. It was within walking distance from the strip but did not have all the traffic. Terrible's appeared to be a favorate of the locals, small but friendly. Locals can cash their pay checks there and earn gasoline, milk, cigarettes, kitchen utensils, tools or many other things in their point cataloge, not just touristy stuff. I felt the buffet was excellent with a different menu every night, heavy on Tex-Mex foods. The full service restaurant was good too. The staff were all very helpfull and cheerfull. One cocktail waitress remembered what I drink and brought me fresh ones, sometimes without me realizing she had been there, I would turn to my side and there would be a fresh drink. The pool was private from the public and was very nicely landscaped with lots of chairs, tables and umbrellas. What I really liked and rarely see was an outdoor hot tub that was really hot. I really wished I could of stayed longer. They provided a free shuttle back to my airport gate. In all I had a very good time at Terrible's and much prefer it over the huge, fancy and more expensive strip hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Killagrey
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this review because I have read some things that are not true that other people have said. We have stayed at Terrible's for the last 3 years and will be booking a room again next year. The Tower room is quite spacious, so is the bathroom. THEY DO HAVE A FITNESS ROOM. I have never seen hookers. Our room was quiet and smoke free. The staff was friendly and helped us when ever we needed something. Parking was easy. The food was great and cheap. We won 3 free dinners just by swiping our players club card. I like Terribles and you can't beat the price!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Rez2
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nothing special in terms of appearance, but I felt it was a good value for the money. My wireless Internet connection was not working initially, but I was able to get it working after calling the operator (a call that I was charged for, to my annoyance, but it was a minor charge). The $10 buffet is also a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: 0602bird
Reviews.Content: Absolutely terrible hotel.We reserve non smoking King bed. First Jone at the front desk gave us a smoking and two beds with out letting us know. Jone offer bad service refuses change and accommodate us. Jone has no smile on his face and did't said welcome and enjoy stay. The room is a heavey smoking room with cigarette burn on carpet everywhere. We only had 3 hours sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Good & Bad”
Reviews.Author: bexnate
Reviews.Content: Terrible's Hotel & Casino is inexpensive, which is great when traveling with two 13-year-old boys who need to eat constantly. I booked one room a week before a huge basketball tournament in Vegas and needed somewhere off the strip, with a nice pool, with a fairly inexpensive room. I paid $413 for 6 nights. The pool was nice (could have been skimmed more frequently) and the room was cheap but small and had a smoky smell even tho it was a nonsmoking room. The bathroom was quite tiny and the shower did not work well. As other reviewers have mentioned the customer service is not top notch, however Matt at the front desk was very helpful on two occasions, and Greg in the cafe was the best server. Also, Alicia in housekeeping went the extra mile. Everyone else did their job and did smile or look like they were happy to be working. Oh well. I didn't expect much, and was pleasantly surprised at the three employees mentioned who were excellent. The location is OK, off the strip a little but you can walk to the strip if you are capable of withstanding the heat. We walked one day from 11 a.m. to 7 p.m. and saw the Flamingo, Caesar's, NY NY, MGM, Planet Hollywood. There is a mini mart/gas station across the street, a McDonald's and Starbucks down the road, PF Changs across the street, Hof Brau Haus a block away. The airport is very close, maybe a 5-10 min drive, depending on traffic. I CANNOT recommend this hotel to families, however. I HAD to stay there for the event, but I would not have wanted to be there with my husband and 5-year-old. There are a lot of hookers and partiers wandering the hotel. The ameneties listed on alaska airlines.com website are incorrect and misleading. There is no McDonald's on site, no laundry on site, no fitness center on site. If you are single, a smoker, like to gamble, like cheap eats (not great, but not horrible food), want some shade by the pool, then Terrible's will suit you fine. If you are traveling with your family, I would suggest something a little more upscale, like the Courtyard by Marriott on Russell & Dean Martin.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump! Lives up to it's name!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kitty1515
Reviews.Content: Bad part of town...I almost tripped over someone shooting-up on my way to check out the pool. Dirty and dark halls, carpeting looks like a bunch of Shar-Pei's sleeping ....the elevators stunk, filthy also....Air conditioning was not working (110 degrees outside) and the toilet was running constantly The house phones do not work....so don't try to get a taxi that way!

Reviews.Title: “A must for Vegas on a budget”
Reviews.Author: mcadrenaline
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night on a Saturday in July on a last minute trip. Our standard room was $39 and we found this place to be an incredible value overall. It was the World Series of Poker so even the 'cheap' hotels on the Strip were $200+. PASS! Enter Terrible's.... We took the free shuttle from the airport (call from your cell phone or airport phone when you get in to LAS, it's by request only) and got to the hotel at 10am and we got our room no problem. Check in was pretty slow, but the girl was very nice. The room was a little outdated, but fairly clean. Nice beds, a 42" flat screen TV and FAST free Wi-Fi were nice. Small bathroom and thin towels were prob my only complaints. Pool area was nothing special and definitely a little worn around the edges, nothing like the elitist, fancy Strip pools. This is where you come to drink $1.50 beers and kill some time. Nice view of landings into LAS airport too ;-) The hotel is a $10 cab ride from the Strip, or you can walk in about 15-20 mins. You can also walk to the Hard Rock which is across the street. One of the best reasons to stay here is the food. Their restaurant, Bouganvilla Cafe is a great choice for Vegas dining on a budget. Huge menu with great options. You'd be hard pressed to spend more than $10 per meal. The food is cheap and better than it has to be. Service differs, but who cares, it's still a great value. Check out their $9.99 steak and ribs special...most even come with a free beer! Also, the hotel has a 7/11 type convenience store on site with street prices...nothing is marked up like on the Strip. 24oz beers are $1.50 just like at the gas station across the street. They also have snacks, liquor, wine and souvenirs. We bought beer here and drank it out at the pool. I think I got significantly drunk for the same price as 1 beer at the pool at the MGM. FYI -- This places is a locals hang out, so it's definitely a "different" clientele than you will experience at most of the other tourist casinos. Not necessarily a bad thing though.

Reviews.Title: “great accomadations - great staff”
Reviews.Author: donna048
Reviews.Content: I had to book this trip at quick notice. My sister lives next door at Cobble stone Creek apartment complex. She is very ill, so I considered myself lucky to stay at Terrible's,not knowing what the rooms were like.My daughter and I were very impressed with our room. It was very clean and the dining room had great food and the help were as capable as anywhere I have stayed in Vegas. You made my sad trip bearable.

Reviews.Title: “It's not”
Reviews.Author: canuck169
Reviews.Content: I had read enough to feel pretty comfortable that Terrible's was not Terrible at all. That was confirmed on a four night stay. Check-in - Slow but they had my info, and hassles. The registration desk is in the middle/back of the casino. Room: I paid $30/night for a non-smoking king. The bed was indeed a king and was comfy. The room had a 42 inch flat panel, though the selection of channels was perhaps just 15 or so. Bathroom was small but fine. It was a combo shower and tub - one of those prefab things. Hallway was usually quiet. Getting to room meant going all the way to end of hall and doubling back. No safe in room. No ironing board but that was supplied when I asked. Free wi-fi, and it worked. Shops: The gift shop had a lot of stuff - from cigars to beer and wine - all at street prices. A bottle of beer that should cost $1.29 cost $1.29. In a casino hotel!!! Restaurant: Locals eat here. Huge plates. Low prices. Not gourmet fare, but I had a half-chicken and a side salad and it was $8. Services: Getting a taxi is tough, but you can walk over to the Hard Rock Hotel if you are getting no love. They have an airport shuttle ... maybe. Got mixed reports on that. Pool: small pool in inner court, clean and just fine Casino - low ceilings, smoke-filled and populated mostly by locals. I would not have hung out with any of these people. Pretty rough looking bunch, but there was lots of security. Mostly slot machines. I don't gamble so cant's say much. Location - You can walk to the convention center or strip if you like to walk. Takes maybe 20 minutes. Very close to airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: jah5546
Reviews.Content: You need to heat the pool a little, we llike to swim but the pool was to cold. we had a great time at terribles, we'll be coming back again. Gordon & Judy Haas 212 W. Main St Mt. Morris, Illinois PS Good maid service , Maria was the best.

Reviews.Title: “Casino looks a little shady, rooms were wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: knc81
Reviews.Content: We had a huge room! The bed was comfy with a pillow top mattress. I wish the blanket was a little thicker and warmer. We had a huge plasma TV. Completely remodeled. The bathroom was fixed up, but not remodeled. No problems there. No fridge. The hotel was very close to the airport and there was free airport transportation at 4:15 a.m. Other hotels that offered free airport transportation did so on their schedule, not yours. Terribles offered free airport transportation on your schedule for free! (we tipped) The pool area looked so cute, wish we could have used it. Our room had a nice view of the pool. The hallways and stairways were a little dark and I wouldn't want to walk them alone, though I believe they were safe, just dark. We paid $34 a night and they gave us a 10% AAA discount. So worth the price! If we need airport transportation again, we would stay here again and recommend this place. Great hotel! Very happy!

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat Terrible's”
Reviews.Author: JenRZ
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at Terribles from April 29-May 2. Our room was CHEAP! It was only 35 per night on the weekend and 29 for Thursday. The beds andn pillows were comfortable. The pool was very nice. The weather was a bit too chilly to enjoy it. We had lunch at the restaurant was a little slow. But, the food was just fine. Again, can't beat the price. The gambling there was great. The only place in Vegas where I will ever gamble again. The bartender, Roberto, was incredibly friendly. The dealers at craps and blackjack are helpful and fun. Loani the blackjack dealer cracked us up. The craps dealer actually bet his tips and we both won! Was it a little smoky? Sure it was! This seems to be the place locals go and it not high end like the Belagio, but, you can take a cab to get the glamorous casino stuff. Then come back to good old friendly Terrible's!

Reviews.Title: “An odd but funky kinda place - near the Strip”
Reviews.Author: KIMRICHES3
Reviews.Content: My flght was delayed and I ended up staying here. I wasn't expecting much as it was far cheaper than hotels on the strip and called Terribles. We booked the best room they had for 49 bucks and it was great! 42 inch plasma screen, king size bed, nice view , clean and modern looking room. The casino has a lovely pool and jacuzzi next door, a bingo hall and all you can eat buffett for breakfast, lunch and dinner (10 bucks for 2 with a coupon). An alternative restaurant which was pretty good. There's a small fitness centre with free internet access there also. Located approximately 25mins walk from the strip and at just 29 bucks starting rate, you simply can't moan at that! Hard Rock Cafe is a short walk from the hotel and there are little supermarkets, laudrette etc within a 5 min walk. They've also got a free shuttle bus to take you to and from the airport - book through reception. Overall, my experience was great and I would definately go back if I ever get stranded in Vegas again! Only downside was the reception staff, with the exception of one lovely guy named Cole, the others were lacking in customer service. Hand on my heart, I don't think I ever saw one smile or even look remotely interested in helping you with anything.

Reviews.Title: “OK Place”
Reviews.Author: FunLuvinKat
Reviews.Content: The reviews about the casino are accurate. Lots of smoke, if you have allergies, stay away from the casino area. The casino and the hotel do look dated and they are in need of a face lift. The room was in need of paint and some TLC, but it was clean and comfortable. The walls are a bit thin, but no need to worry about drunk kids running around making noise.

Reviews.Title: “terrible? you mean horrible!”
Reviews.Author: eilatan88
Reviews.Content: We arrived in this hotel because our flat had been cancelled, so that our flight compagny booked this hotel for us as they have an agreement together. When we arrived, we were told immediately where the gambling machines and the gift shop where. (we had spent all our dollar left, expecting to be back to France) We were abolutely tired by our expectation at the airport , what the receptionnist knew, as we were several gests from the same cancelled flight and were not here for gambling, but to have a forced rest until another flight can take us. The room was very old and dirty, and had a terrible smell (we asked for a smoking room but that was smelling other things). We were said to have a view other the swimming pool, we had a view other a big fence. Someone has made a jogging all night long in the room just up ours'. No sleep. We asked the receptionnist to order a taxi for the next day, what the flight compagny paid for, she said no you have to take our shuttle and pay the driver, we refused. We tried at night to order another taxi with another receptionnist, he told us to go outside and phone from a public box. In the morning we took their shuttle without paying the driver, but arrived 2 hours too early than if we had taken a taxi. This was our last night in Vegas. There are so cheap and nice hotels, that go somewhere else!!

Reviews.Title: “not for everyone but it is for ME”
Reviews.Author: ACOAMADEUS
Reviews.Content: If you want to live it up spending tons of money right on the strip and being ripped for drinks, Terrible's isnt for you. However if you want a good value base off the strip with cheap drinks and food and arent worried about mixing with locals, then give it a try. The pool area is one of the most relaxing in Vegas and you dont have to walk for hours to get there. I will happily return again and again. Yes it is on the cheap tacky side but thats the charm of the place. and that said, the rooms and beds are on a par with any medium grade hotel. PLUS it is across the road from Roy's Hawaiian Fusion which has to be one of the best dining experiences in Vegas,

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable & Insulting”
Reviews.Author: mikeyi42
Reviews.Content: After reading so much about Ted's I thought I would pop in and see for myself what it was all about. We were staying at the Monte Carlo and made a special trip there. Big mistake. From the moment we walked in things were not right. The tables were not busy so my group sat down to play some black jack. As my cousin started to explain the system he was using the dealer piped in with a snide remark "where are you from MIT??" letting that remark slide we conitnued to play through a couple shoes when the dealers switched, and not for the better. I placed one hundred down and requested nickles where the dealer only gave me half . As I stated I required all in nickels she cried back, she needed them. Seeing as we were the only players (3 people) at the table I wondered if she would be playing. We continued to play but the atmosphere projected by the dealer was just not comforting. We cashed out and as I was leaving gave the dealer a tip as I had won some money. She at first ignored me and as I indicted that what was on the table was for her she flicked it back at me. Not sure if it was a language barrier, or the fact that we were not locals. but it definitely was a wasted excursiom. We crossed the road and went to the Hard Rock were we ate a great meal. gambled more and were treated far more decently,,

Reviews.Title: “Terribly good”
Reviews.Author: Ningu1
Reviews.Content: For the price, this is an very good deal on a weekend in Las Vegas*. The rooms are clean and functional with all amenities. The decor might be a bit dated but it is by no means depressing. The staff are friendly and eager to please. Even though it is a budget property, the hotel encapsulates the true Vegas experience as the ground floor is a casino and the neon lighting inside & out add to the traditional Vegas bling. The location is excellent within walking distance of the best part of the strip (near the Bellagio). I would highly recommend this hotel for those on a budget. * You might be able to stay at higher end properties in Vegas for the same price mid-week, as they sometimes drop their rates considerably. Either way, this is a great place to stay in Vegas and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “A 2nd Time Terrible, No Terrific”
Reviews.Author: Lifetraveler1
Reviews.Content: Recently attended the 2010 CES Show in Las Vegas, NV. As I am always on a budget, I monitored the room rates for months. The ones on the strip was ridiculously high as usual, but I noticed that there was a prominent drop in prices about a week before the event started. However, the prices were still higher than I wanted to pay. So I made a choice between two locations (Sams Town Hotel and Casino and Terribles Hotel and Casino) that I had visited before that I felt provided great value. Sam's Town is a great value at about $45 a nite for three nights. with very nice accommodations, but it was further out on Boulder Highway. Terribles Hotel at about $55 a nite was a bit closer to the strip and directly on the same street as the convention (still a 1.1 mile walk). Outside Appearance: Can't quite describe it other than to say it looks like a mix of cowboy and egyptian. Definitely an older building, but definitely not rundown in any way. There is parking in a garage, but I prefer parking in the regular lot for quick access to the rental car. Location: It is about a mile from the convention center and there are busses that run down that way. It is also about a mile from the strip down E. Flamingo Road to the Bellagio. A Bahama Breeze, PF Changs and a mexican chain restaurant are just across the street. Room: On the previous visit my wife and I got a magnificent room for the price in the tower (newer) building. On this visit I cut cost and asked for a standard room. I was surprised to find that it was almost as nice as the one we had before. Flat panel tv in the room, basic yet very nice decor, carpet was clean, furnishings were decent and not worn in any way. The bathroom was cleaned and well stocked and I was given a room facing the courtyard with the nice pool. I took a few pictures, which I accidently just deleted. The rooms used the key cards and I felt quite safe and comfortable in my room and at the hotel. Food: For some strange reason the breakfast buffet does not start until 9am, so I zipped on over to the Monte Carlo and had breakfast over there, because it has always been good. Extras: On my third day I skipped the convention and did a little sight seeing over to the Grand Canyon (one picture here). The hotel was nice enough to let me have a late check-out. That way when I got back I could just take another shower and head for the airport. Oh yes, they have free wireless (unsecured) and it was very fast. Terribles was still good on my 2nd time around. If it is full and you want to save money and you also have a rental car, Sams Town is a good alternative. One Thing: The hotel lobby is always very smoky! Have yet to figure out why the desk staff doesn't pass out from it. Here's a few pictures of the places that I saw while I was down there.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, affordable and easy to navigate!”
Reviews.Author: VegasladyTrenton
Reviews.Content: Both my husband and I like the smaller hotels and Terrible's meets our needs! The buffet is great as is the restaurant. The rooms are very nice and the pillow top beds are excellent. It is quite close to the Strip and the Fashion Show Place Mall. The Bingo and the bingo workers are super!! It is also quite close to the airport and the limo service to and from is super!! We have made friends with a lot of the employees so it always feels like we are coming "home"!

Reviews.Title: “What Do You Expect for $21?”
Reviews.Author: kabbagehead
Reviews.Content: I decided to go to Vegas a day early and needed a place to flop for one night before relocating to Tuscany Suites. So, I went on Expedia and found Terrible's. What really sold me was the free shuttle to and from the hotel. I think the few companies that run shuttles from the airport to the hotels are a rip-off, and cabs even more so. Upon arriving at the airport, it took me about a half an hour to find out where to pick up the shuttle (Level Zero, a floor BELOW Baggage Claim), but when I did, I was pretty blown away: a pimped-out stretch SUV limo painted bright red. And free bottled water inside! This is a wonderful touch, and Terrible's is to be commended for this. Once you arrive at the hotel, your expectations should be more in line with what to expect with this level of hotel. Check in was quick and easy, if a little brusque. The casino is smoky and crowded. The room was clean, but definitely showed its age. This hotel actually used to be a place called The Continental, and was reported to be a total dive. But the room was clean. The bathroom definitely was about as basic as you can get. A flat-screen TV was a nice touch. The room was quiet. Overall, I'd put this on level with an average or slightly below Motel 6. Terrible's Bougainville(?) coffee shop was a very good deal, though service was slow. For $21, this is a relative bargain, though I came at a really dead time of the year, the week of Christmas. If you are willing to spend an extra $15 for the night, you can get something significantly better...but will probably give up the free shuttle. It's also worth noting one other thing: I am by no means a snob; in fact, I avoid the Strip hotels because of all the posers staying there. That said, Terrible's seemed ripe with people more than a little down on their luck, and they seemed to wear that in their appearance. It's just a fact of staying at a place like this. Consider this: A round-trip on a regular airport shuttle will run you about $12; for an extra $9, you might get a clean bed to sleep in as well!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible's is not all terrible.”
Reviews.Author: Scoutiej
Reviews.Content: Nice comfortable beds, a BIG plus. Clean rooms. Couldn't believe there's no little microwaves or refrigerators in each room, I'm sure they make enough money from casino gambling to upgrade this. If you have a medical issue and need to refrigerate medicine it's a crap shoot to see if a small refrigerator is available to be brought to your room. And NO, you can't reserve that either! I reserved a particular room 2 months ahead, when I arrived it was rented out. Guess it's all about money and not guest service. Would be nice if they had an Avis rental car desk at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “vegas”
Reviews.Author: DanielT4
Reviews.Content: great hotel and casino. great chance to win some cash and have some fun. indoor rollercoaster, great drinks and lots of slots and tables to play on. the rooms were about average but still nice a must see on the way to vegas esp. coming from california. ps its a great way to save some cash on hotel expenses.

Reviews.Title: “Place lives up to its name”
Reviews.Author: nikali
Reviews.Content: This place is TERRIBLE! I have never seen such bad service! My boyfriend and I went there to eat at their cafe for some steak and eggs. We were seated and sat there for over 20 minutes! No one came to our table to get our order! People at the next table had the same terrible service. Waiters excuse?- "sorry, they're cutting hours" STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE!! We left this place and had our steak and eggs at bob's big boy on the way home.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: keithbs
Reviews.Content: Noooooo, it's not the Belaggio, but Terrible's is a decent hotel at a decent price. The casino seemed a bit smoker than the newer hotels on the strip, but not too bad. One downside was the lack luster food in both the buffet and the restaurant. Both use the same kitchen and the food seemed to be more out of the can than prepared from fresh. The buffet had less options than other hotels, but it did not have the sky high prices either. A bonus was the free wireless!! Overall, we had a good visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Casino Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WILDDOG
Reviews.Content: Don't let the name scare you, 1st I'm a low player on the slot machines but I play for many hrs at a time. The machines are some of the loosest in Las Vegas and if you are looking for many $.01 slots to play this is your place to go and stay. I got my room for $19.00 a night with free transfer to and from the airport about a 10 min ride. The Hotel is located on Paridise rd and Flamingo Ave.about a 1block walk from The Hard Rock Casino Hotel. The rooms are large and have new 36" flat screen TV's, beds are really comformable,,and coffee pots are in room too! They do have suites that go for around $59-69.00 for mid weeks and $7 for weekends but you can still get better rates if you hunt around. Slots are 10 pts on Sundays and Tues and Thurs. they are 5 times for pts, so you can really work up your comp pts rates fast. Buffet is very decent and large btu te food is like all buffets not really hot. The other restuarant is very good $ very decent and portions are very large and food is hot. You can really get great deals after 11:00pm like 16oz new york strip 2 eggs hash browns, garlic toast for $6.99 and it is a very good cut of meat too! It is about a 1 mile walk to the strip but like I said if you like to walk save money, get great hotel and casino with free transfers, this is a can't miss place to stay and save your other money for doing what you when to Las Vegas for lol! There is a decent size swimming pool with free towels and a spa tub kept at 104 degrees. You can get from your room to the casino in about a 5 min tme, for me it was about 3 min time ! My rating would be a good 3 1/2 rating I have stayed at Terrible's about 10 12 times.

Reviews.Title: “Should be called Horribles”
Reviews.Author: Noez01
Reviews.Content: I guess when I pulled in the parking lot only to find a security staff member asleep in his truck I should have known. The lobby clientele resembled a homeless shelter. After a 25 min wait at check in I was given the wrong directions to the elevator. The room was OK but the wet stain on the carpet grossed me out so I asked for another room. The second non smoking room smelled of smoke but I didn't want to change again. Television was inoperable several times and I had to call. Bed was clean but not comfortable. Decided to try the breakfast buffet one morning and wished I hadn't. Runny eggs & other gross entrees made not so hungry all of a sudden. Never again! Bottom line: You can do much better for the price. This place is owned & operated by the same folks that brought you Terrible's gas stations - nuff said.

Reviews.Title: “A small paradise on Paradise Road...”
Reviews.Author: barbaraindrago
Reviews.Content: We love it. We are staying here for the 2nd time now and we enjoy every minute of it. The food is great. It is a matter of taste, but I do not like american food, it is so unhealty and fat (we are from Europe and are not used to eat so many hamburgers, fries, ...). But here (Bouganvilla Caffe) i do like it. And prices are great. We had to move to another hotel for few days inbetween, because everything was full here, and I was so sad. Now we are back. Juhu. They have so many extras for such small price, like coffee in the room, free WIFI (this alone costs us 20 USD per day extra in other hotels). Now we are paying 27 USD (with tax) for a standard room, which is fine, big enough and clean. In our first room the windows were broken, so we couldn t open them,this was not so good, but now everything is ok. I don t have any complaint (usually I do ) Service is great, they are all very friendly and helpful. The pool area is so nice, I just went out few minutes ago, the jaccuzzi is nice and very warm,if not hot. And it is so peaceful. Just birds and music - not loud. If you don t like crowds and big hotels, this place is great, great, great. They have lots of benefits and after we finish our Grand canyon trip, we will be back, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “A great location and and even better price”
Reviews.Author: amandasattic
Reviews.Content: Terrible's has a great location (just north of the airport, adjacent to University of Nevada at Las Vegas, and close to "The Strip"). The rooms are fairly large and the beds were comfortable. My room was in the older three-story section of the hotel, which was showing its age a little (drain in bathroom sink would not stay closed, wallpaper starting to come up at the corner, etc.), but I have no major complaints. Parking was convenient (in a lot right at the hallway to my room) and free. The hotel surrounds a courtyard where the swimming pool is located. Since my stay was in October, no one was using the pool, so this was a good place to relax away from others. I did not use the restaurant. My brother and I stayed in one room both Saturday and Sundays nights for less than $100.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel for a low price.”
Reviews.Author: jenbennoho
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on Saturday night of Labor Day weekend. We paid $79 through Priceline. This was our second time staying here. This is a nice place to stay when you want quality for a low price. The pool is nice and the room was clean. The property is not that big so it is easy to find your way around. The staff was very nice. I would definitely stay here again when all the other hotels are too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great, for what it was”
Reviews.Author: SurprisingWoman
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Vegas for the five star food, and resort style service then you don't want to stay here. If you are looking for a clean, well maintained hotel/casino for a good price then you have found your place. Our room was HUGE for the price, very clean, quiet, dark and we couldn't have been happier. \ The casino seems to be a favorite among the locals, that says good things to me. Join the casino club card thing, there are a lot of benefits to it. The buffet is AWFUL. Do not waste your money or time. We got two breakfast buffets for free..... they were a waste of our time. Uck. Gamble here, sleep here, just don't eat here. Great location, close to the strip and Starbucks, grocery stores and Sam's club. For dinner try the Ghandi's across the street. It's AMAZING Indian food.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Beat the off-season price”
Reviews.Author: lucksgirl
Reviews.Content: Had to travel to Vegas in the dead of the summer heat for business. Just needed a decent, no-frills, safe place to rest my head for 2 nights. Have been to Terrible's before to gamble and for the cheap breakfast so when I saw a rate of $42 for 2 nights on hotels.com I booked. Terrible's is right off the strip- a quick and cheap cab ride from the big casinos on the strip. Hard Rock Casino is right across the street. Easy check-in, easy check out. Nice, clean room. Only complaint was when I got off the elevator on my room floor, there was no AC in the hallway! It was 110 degrees outside! It was like walking thru a sauna to get to my room. But the room AC was going full blast. At that rate, I would definitely stay again. And I would also consider this place as a cheaper alternative to the strip hotels during the busy season.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel at a great place, walking distance from the Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: veeRob
Reviews.Content: I went to see Blink-182 at the Hard Rock this past Thursday, and since my girlfriend was flying out of town super early the next morning, I wanted a cheap hotel room in the area. Terrible's was only a block from the Hard Rock, so for $25 I couldn't pass up staying here. I ended up booking three nights due to a hotels.com promotion -- buy 3 nights, get a $55 prepaid MasterCard sent to you a month later. So I saved $5 and got 2 extra nights! The first night I checked in super late, and they didn't have a king bed rooms available, so I got a room with two queens. They moved me to a king bed room the next morning upon my request. Both rooms were in the old tower and have definitely seen better days, but I wasn't really picky at the price I got. I was pleased the rooms all had plasma TV's, but there were only about seven channels to choose from. Again, I'm not too picky, just passing it along. The hotel also offers free WiFi, but keep in mind that it's free and may not work great -- one day it was horrible and the next day it was great. For the price, I'll definitely be booking a stay again if I attend a concert at the Hard Rock and want a place nearby to crash.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: SHoweBathUK
Reviews.Content: I first stayed in this hotel when my father and I did Route 66 two years ago. Its a great location just off the Strip and away from the mayhem. Its cheap but has a gym and free internet. The rooms are clean and neat and are also big. You REALLY can't complain for $35 per night. The beds were very comfortable and we had a quiet room. The casino is not the best but then you can walk up the road and straight into the Bellagio if that's what you're after.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled by the name”
Reviews.Author: pooh12271
Reviews.Content: Pros: cost, shuttle service to/from the airport, onsite restaurants, comps for gambling Cons: rude shuttle driver when we were picked up at the airport, the food at the buffet was disgusting, no internet access

Reviews.Title: “Good as ever”
Reviews.Author: redfan
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from our latest visit to Las Vegas and our seventh stay at Terribles.We would not stay anywhere else after finding Terribles some years ago.The location is no problem if you have a car and the property is so compact with short walks to your room from the carpark or restaurant.The food served in the restaurant is very good and very reasonably priced.The casino is large enough and has a good variety of slots.Most of the staff are fine with of course the usual one or two exceptions that you seem to encounter everywhere you go.We like to visit all the big hotels on the strip but would not stay in one of them again as Terribles suits us just fine.As we live in the UK we always stay for 2 weeks and like to enjoy the slower pace in Terribles than the larger noisier properties elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “THE Hotel for Couples on a budget.”
Reviews.Author: kellyinak
Reviews.Content: If you like being on the strip, keep in mind you will probably need a car to travel from Terrible's. We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. The room was similar to a Best Western. It was clean, and the bed was comfortable. The casino was great! Excellent play back on the slots and the blackjack tables were great. The staff is friendly, the drinks were free flowing. The downfall is that they need a better vent system. The place can get smokey. We stayed in the older part of the hotel. Would definitely recommend staying in the new tower. Sign up for the Players Card. You will get free slot play and a hat or Tshirt. Will stay there again, but will request a newer room, even if we have to pay more. Overall a good experience, especially for couples on a budget. Did not try the buffet but the cafe had good food and good prices. Also, this has a great Pool. Very cozy. lots of trees and even gardenia plants.

Reviews.Title: “Certainly Not Terrible !”
Reviews.Author: imajoseph
Reviews.Content: Was a bit hesitant when booking this hotel especially with the name to go along with it, was looking for a budget hotel for a 4 night first time stay in Vegas with 3 friends, we booked 2 queen rooms (2 in each room). The hotel shuttle was great, i didnt see many other hotels offering this, we had to wait quite a while for it though upon arrival at the airport, over 30 mins, although we did land late around 11pm on a wednesday night. It was a short 10 min ride from the airport, knowing that we could have easily got a cab and saved the waiting, the shuttle on the way back to the airport was perfect, we ordered it at the front desk and was there right on time. There was huge car park out front too that always had parking spots. On checking in we didnt have to wait long, they said only 1 of our queen rooms was available at the moment so they apologised and put me and my friend in a ground floor "suite" can you say BONUS !!!! it was fantastic, the desk said that our queen room would be ready the day after if we wanted to come back and get the key....not a chance !!! the suite was awesome, with 2 seperate rooms, 2 plasma's, a gambling table, fridge, jet tub, walk in shower, king bed, walk out to a double sized patio from either room, we totally loved the room and made our trip more special, hence to say we avoided the front desk for the rest of our stay so they wouldnt move us ! the queen room that our friends had was ok, no complaints, plasma, good sized bathroom, 2 queen beds, nice view of the pool area. The pool area was nice and was never busy, in fact we only ever saw a handful of people round it, it was nice and big and lined with palm tree's, a very nice setting. the hotel was relatively quiet compared to the strip, you couldnt hear any noise late at night, the casino was great, although not too big but had everything you needed, some good low rate tables too and plenty slots, the bar in the casino was good too, it offered happy hour drinks every day from 4-7 that were $2 draft beers , awesome deal. We ate at the restaurant in the hotel on the first floor every day, the food and value for money was fantastic, the portion sizes were enormous, even at breakfast, for the price it couldnt be beat and the selection on the menu was the largest ive ever seen, a steak and egg breakfast would only cost us $5 and an evening meal you could easily eat for under $10. it was never busy and we got a table right away every time. They even have their own brand of Terrible Ketchup and brown sauce and Terrible wine. It was a good 15 minute walk to the strip which brought you out at Bills/Ballys, we got a cab a few times and was only $5 or so, especially late at night we didnt fancy the walk back, For an off strip hotel the distance wasnt too far i expected further. There is a walgreens or 7/11 i cant remember, right across the road where they sell beer and all the usual things, we would stock up our fridge in our room instead of buying things in the hotel during the day. All in all we never had a single complaint about the hotel, except my friend who saw 1 tiny cockroach upon arrival in our room, we never saw a single one after that. i would definatly reccommend this hotel if you want a low budget hotel thats off strip and a bit quieter (although the casino was always busy) Definately NOT Terrible and will stay again there in a heartbeat !

Reviews.Title: “Worked for me.....”
Reviews.Author: oztar
Reviews.Content: OK folks heres my "recent" review of Terribles.....I got there Sunday the 24 th @ 3 p.m. and there was NOBODY in line for check-in (sweet) check-in was FAST !!! I was off to my "standard" room within minutes, the older room was very clean w/a large flat screen tv, coffee maker ( I do not drink coffee) hair dryer etc. there was however a mystery stain on the carpet I figured out to be wax (no biggie) other than that the room was just fine for me, it was a smoking room and still had no real strong odor, now for the maids, I swear they knew when I left the room! one morning I was gone 1.5 hrs. and came back to get something and it was clean and smelling good!! I never even seen them (?) I remember "other" Vegas hotels having to wait until 4-5 pm to get the room cleaned ( you all can relate) Now the casino, YES it does smell of cigs, but hey, its a small older casino and theres smokers ...its not THAT bad as others lead on to be, the slots were good not great but good, they keep you playing and do pay out, just gotta know when to cash out! duh... I did go to see my aunt @ Ballys and won $1585 !!! on the slots..woohoo. Ok now food, the buffet was Hmmmm OK , room service ( yes room service) was good I got the Turkey Club w/seasoned fries ( VERY GOOD) and the total was $11.06, I do not think that was too bad seeing how I was in a hurry and needed quick food, there were there within 20 minutes!....the parking was good ,SAFE and very quick trip to room etc. I saw they had a shuttle to/from airport but never used it, also, I needed a cab one day and waited and waited out front only to see there were NO cabs around (?) I went to the front desk to ask about a cab and she said she'll call one, no sooner did I get to the front door the cab was there! (nice) so folks, all in all Terribles is a fine place, for the $25 a night I paid ( Hotels.com) it was worth it , No Drunk Fratboys, No kids, No Snobs just regular people like me who want a cheap/clean QUIET place to gamble. Oh, one last thing ( I could kick myself ) I never got a players card, GET ONE, they give you a coupon book w/it that has all kinds of goodies..Oh, just one more thing, the pool is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal for me”
Reviews.Author: RADRACING
Reviews.Content: At a fraction of the cost of any hotel on the strip, a few blocks away, this is a great deal. I have stayed here several times, Rooms are big and clean, as good as many main brand rooms on the strip. I save enough on rooms to get a rental car for the whole week and still have hundreds of savings( to gamble). The same size room can cost a couple hundred a night on the strip especially on friday and saturday nights when the rates go way up, and the expensive rooms are no better. The casino and restaurants are modest, with the money I save I just jump in my rental car and eat and gamble at any casino in the city, the savings are enormous. Since all the casinos have free parking you saved enough to see the city and the freedom of not being confined to taxies and waiting for transportation. I love the place mainly because I don't sit in the hotel, I try different casinos, buffets, see different things. Most people do not realize how far it is just to walk to a casino in vegas even when it is side by side, that's where the rental car is invaluable. For me its the best deal.

Reviews.Title: “Value for the buck”
Reviews.Author: MichaelonLI
Reviews.Content: I was travelling with a group of co-workers. I could get comp rooms on the Strip for midweek, but not the weekend. I had no problem moving down the road to save a couple of hundred bucks. Others opted to stay at Bally's for $210 a night, I went with Terribles for $64. I have stayed here before and have never been disappointed. I arrived around noon on Friday and asked for a third floor courtyard room with a king bed, which they had ready. I brought one of my fellow travelers along with me. He was curious to see what kind of room you get in a place called Terribles. He was pleasantly surprised; spacious clean, and comfortable. I think he was asking himself why he was paying three times more for a comprable room down the road. The room has a flat screen TV and a coffee maker. The courtyard rooms are quiet. One thing I love about the rooms is that the windows open. Unless it is oppressively hot, I prefer to sleep with fresh air coming in, rather than an AC blowing. You can't find that in too many places on the Strip. The one weak link in the room is the bathroom, it is tiny. But when you are by yourself, that is really not an issue. (The tower rooms have larger bathrooms). I love the casino, it has all my favorite games. I cannot find Spin Poker on the Strip, Terribles must have a dozen of them. The pool is peaceful and relaxing. Go out anytime during the day and there is no problem finding a chaise in either the sun or shade. Cocktail service is abundant. The breakfast buffet is great; fresh waffles and an omlette station among other things. And during my time I earned enough points to pay for one night's accommodation and two meals. With taxes, I paid a tad less than $70 for the weekend. My friend's bill approached the $500 mark. If you don't have a car, you are looking at either a $1.75 bus ride, $10 taxi ride, or 1 mile walk to the Strip. (However, they do have a free airport shuttle.) You also get the ambience of locals casino which means a little less bling and a bit more smoke. But all in all it adds to the experience. I love this place and will continue to come here for great gambling and unprecedented value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: GlasgowSteve
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th time in vegas 1st time off the strip.We stayed on the3rd floor not a tower room which was big and clean.[so no need to upgrade to a tower room]. This hotel is great value for money, for example 2 drinks cost $5 compared to $15 on the strip. The food is reasonable and the pool area is nice and quiet. It takes approx 20 mins to walk to the strip and we sometimes took a taxi to Bally's which cost $8. Would very much recommend this hotel. We much preferred this hotel to the strip hotels.

Reviews.Title: “The name is fitting”
Reviews.Author: PrincessFiona61
Reviews.Content: Stay away - stay far away. Although we didn't actually stay at this property we did spend a couple of hours in the casino before our plane was due to leave. We arrived in the afternoon on April 24th with our friends and parked the car in the parking lot outside the casino. We returned to the car and proceeded to the airport. Upon arrival at the airport we unloaded the luggage from the car only to discover the car had been broken into and our bag containing our laptop, travelers cheques & passports was gone. Our friend lost their cameras. A security guard outside the airport happened to over hear the conversation and stated that was a really bad area. As we did not have time to return to the property to make a complaint I called from home the next day. The person I spoke to in the security department was totally useless and finally in frustration I hung up the phone. I have contacted the hotel/casino by e-mail but have not heard anything back from them yet.

Reviews.Title: “very nice cheap hotel”
Reviews.Author: Timmy536
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights for $24 a night. We thought that no one else was staying there because we never saw or heard anyone. The rooms were very clean and big with a huge flat screen TV. The casino and buffet was good. No resort fees! Good basic lodging about as cheap as Vegas offers.

Reviews.Title: “Can't be beat!”
Reviews.Author: paulamos101
Reviews.Content: This was my third trip to Terrible's and, as before, was great. For $158 total (received a coupon in the mail), I had a Tower room overlooking the garden/pool area. The room was large with a good size bathroom, table and 2 chairs, and a flat-screen TV (what so you watch besides the morning news/weather). There was never a problem getting a chaise around the pool, could bring a nice cold beer out from their small store and just relax in the sun. Very convenient! The lobby staff, the dealers and the pit bosses were friendly and fun to deal with. Just about everything I asked for was granted with a smile. The casino is small enough that the dealers and pit staff get to know you... makes for a friendly stay. The Cafe has a wonderful steak dinner for $9.99... including a salad, potato, a steak cooked just the way I requested and a nice cold beer... was delicious! The buffet for breakfast is great. The dinner buffet was fair... some nights were better than others. But again, you can't beat the price. Not everyone visits Vegas with a lot $$$$. If you are traveling on a budget, why spend it on a hotel that one night would cost what 5 nights here cost me. I played $5 Blackjack every day in Terrible's (usually more than once a day)... lost about $100 over the 5 day period... that almost made me feel like a 'winner'. I am already looking forward to my next stay at Terrible's next Spring.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the $$$”
Reviews.Author: trudolstravels
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel for the price. The room was clean, the staff was helpful, and the free airport shuttle was efficient and convenient. It's located accross the street from PF Changs and Morton's Steakhouse. Hard Rock is only about a 5 minute walk. The customers are middle aged and beyond so if you're younger and hip you can always take advantage of the great price at Terribles and then walk to Hard Rock. The room was quiet except for the moderate airplane noise between 6:00 AM - 11:00PM. The bed was a little soft. Overall, I'd say it's an excellent value for the dollar and I will definately stay at Terribles again.

Reviews.Title: “The stench of smoke and booze”
Reviews.Author: mach92flyr
Reviews.Content: A nightmare check in, over 45 minute wait, while the chain smoking boozing casino players stare and wander close to you and your suitcase. The cheap rate lures you in. The room was fairly clean, but the noise from other guests and the parking lot lasted past midnight. Stay at your own risk.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service from reception (Jacque? Jackie?) woman. Never again!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Angola77
Reviews.Content: I have stayed several time with no problem, but I encounter this absolutly rude receptionist I think here name was Jacque, grey hair short, full figuered. She was SO SO rude and slow!!! I wil NEVER come back to this hotel while she is there. It is truly a shame since the rooms are very nice and at a location I like.

Reviews.Title: “loved everything about it.”
Reviews.Author: squibbyEngland
Reviews.Content: cheap chearful friendly, good food.traveld from liverpool England, we love terribles go back every year, better than the strip. you can find your way round within aday. unlike the big hotels.the big hotels are lovely but you get lost in your own hotel. terribles is verry good.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel2u
Reviews.Content: We are never in our room when we go to visit. This hotel is not the Wynn but it is clean, great value and service. Plus I won $$$-- YEAH !!!

Reviews.Title: “Small Hotel! Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: IowaOceanLover
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very clean and well kept! We stayed in the new Tower rooms. Although we didn't use the pool our window overlooked it and it looked very tropical and inviting. The food in this hotel/casino was very reasonable and good. The breakfast buffet is cheap and offered what we wanted. They had an omlet bar/waffles made to order (they were easy to miss as this was our first time there). We did walk the first day to the strip but it was a long walk. We did take the monorail once we got to the strip for $13 all day but it didn't go towards our hotel or didn't stop as many places as the bus. The next day we went to the strip you can take the bus for $7 or $7.50 for an all day pass. We took it to the strip and then to the downtown. We had to walk about a block to catch the bus to go to the strip but coming home it dropped us off at the hotel. The only problem with the bus is we had to stand for a few stops before a seat opened up to sit. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a quiet place to stay. The casino is very smokey though.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: onecall
Reviews.Content: we loved this hotel it was cheap, clean, and freindly we will definately book here again

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, clean rooms but smokey lobby/casino.”
Reviews.Author: KC_and_beyond
Reviews.Content: You can save money by calling the front desk directly to reserve a room. My brother lives in Vegas. This is where the locals come to play and stay. The casino and lobby are VERY SMOKEY. The hallways leading to the older (non tower) rooms are also very smokey. Thankfully the rooms themselves aren't smelly. If you hate smoke then stay in the tower rooms. With the exception of checking in/out, you can by-pass the casino to get to your room. I have stayed in the older rooms since they are so inexpensive. The rooms are clean albeit older. The pictures shown by the property are of the newer, tower rooms. The older rooms look similar to the tower rooms but are not as up-to-date. The tub looks older. The Bouganvillea Cafe is extremely smokey as is the buffet area. You have to walk through the casino to get to the Cafe or buffet area. You can literally see the smoke cloud in the casino and in the Cafe. I have bad allergies and can't handle it. I just skip them. My sister smokes 2 packs a day. She even concedes that it's incredibly smokey. That said, the food is super cheap, but not very good. It is open 24 hours though. We typically walk up to the strip. Don't let looks deceive you. Although you can see the Flamingo, it takes about 30 minutes to walk up there. You will arrive by the Flamingo, Ballys, Caesars and the Bellagio. We usually cab back. You can walk across the street to the Hard Rock Cafe and take the free shuttle to the MGM grand. The shuttle runs every 30 minutes or so. Terrible's also has a free shuttle to and from the airport. If you cab from the airport to Terrible's, it is less than a 5 minute ride. Do not let the cabbie take you on the Freeway down to the strip. You should by-pass the strip completely. Oh, and the cab fares are based on TIME not distance! If you are looking for cheap food/drink on the strip, there is a CVS, McDonalds, Chipotle across from the Mirage and a Walgreens up by the M-n-M factory across from New York New York. Within walking distance of Terrible's you will find Bahama Breeze, PF Changs and Cozymel's restaurants. All are tasty but can be a bit pricey. If you're looking to stay cheap and can manage to get through the smokey atmosphere and up to your room, then Terrible's is worth the price. My family and I have stayed there 6 times now. Although I hate the smoke, the price makes up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Las Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HissyKitty
Reviews.Content: Excellent! We've stayed at Treasure Island, Luxor, Bally's, Stardust, Excalibur and Palace Station and as far as cleanliness, friendliness, convenience of mobililty, price and food is concerned, Terribles is best by a long shot! Our room was beautifully appointed, clean and spacious. The internet was free and the bathroom was huge. We overlooked the beautiful pool and even at halfway down the hallway, the elevator was close. Then it was a simple turn around a corner to the elevator to the hotel's garage to get our car. No valet hassles or long lines or half mile walks to get the car or to go anywhere. The hotel staff was overly professional at getting us tickets to venues elsewhere and making sure that we enjoyed our Vegas adventure. Even tho the casino area is small compared to the strip hotels, the slots were loose and the atmosphere was happy. Did I mention that with a simple phone call ahead of time that they picked us up at the airport in a stretch limo? And that they told us that they'd be happy to take us back whenever we needed to go? And how about a 16oz. New York Strip for $9.99 with a monster sized potatoe and steamed veggies? And the beer was free. But I recommend the marguarita, which was to die for! And unlike the strip hotels, our cellphones worked perfectly in Terribles. I know this for a fact as we toured Imperial Palace, Treasure Island and the Mirage and we couldn't use them to keep in touch. We're happy to say that we have found our "home base" now whenever we go to Las Vegas. Who needs the intimidation of navigating the monster hotels when you can return to a warm and welcoming one like Terribles.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Decent location”
Reviews.Author: Almaden
Reviews.Content: Terrible's was better than expected. They have Motel 6 prices but the rooms are very clean and well maintained. The non-smoking room I had did not smell like smoke which was a nice surprice since the casino and hallways do smell like a smokers convention is in town. The room was a good size and it didn't feel dated or run down. I like that you can park close to your room so that you can get to and from your car quickly... something that you don't get when you stay at the big strip hotels. The location of the hotel is not bad. Its right across the street from the Hard Rock Hotel/Casino and a big block away from the Tuscany Hotel/Casino. It is walkable to the strip but its close to a mile. Also walkable is a drug store and lots of restaurants. Its very easy to get to and from this hotel without the hassles of the strip. I didn't use the pool but it looked OK with decent landscaping around it. So what didn't I like? The casino is small and smoky and there were a few unpleasant folks around including a intoxicated guy who was barking at me about something while I was in the mini mart of the hotel. To the hotels credit, they called security on the guy right away. Even though the casino is very small, they did have live entertainment but unfortunately on this particular night it was pretty awful. It was one guy with a electric guitar and he basically lip synced to music and even faked playing the guitar. Overall though, this hotel is a great deal and we should support places like this as Las Vegas continues to build expensive hotels that are out of many peoples budget.

Reviews.Title: “Wall to Wall Smoke”
Reviews.Author: Dzhugashvili
Reviews.Content: Our flight out of Vegas was canceled on a Friday night. Not wanting to sleep at McCarran, we decided to take the airline's recommendation and stay at Terrible's. On the positive side, the rooms and food are cheap. However, the hotel is equivalent to an old tired Super 8. The rooms are tiny and the furnishings and fixtures are crying to be replaced. There's free entertainment in the casino but be sure to bring a respirator because the thick smoke would cause wheezing in a 2 pay a day addict. All in all, an okay place if you're in a pinch but stay somewhere else if you have a choice.

Reviews.Title: “Go stay on the Strip and leave this place for those in the know”
Reviews.Author: AucklandNelluc
Reviews.Content: stayed here several times. Great value for money. good clean rooms and a lovely pool. I feel sorry for the reviewers who stayed here and felt disappointed as it really isn't a big 'Strip' hotel and it doesnt try to be. The casino is much more geared up to locals. It does however provide a great value for money deal for those who've seen it all before and want to save some money for eating , drinking and of course gambling.

Reviews.Title: “So so..”
Reviews.Author: clarisse79
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent just one night here. The smell of smoke was strong everywhere, even in the elevator or the aisle.. People were talking loudly outside our room at any hour..until 6 in the morning!..At that point we decided to get up and leave the place. The room (except for the smell) was nice..big enough and clean. The hotel is quite far from the Strip, but if you have/rent a car, it's a good solution.

Reviews.Title: “ok for the room rate that I paid”
Reviews.Author: 2coolnca
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for my weekend in Las Vegas by calling the hotel directly. I was given a 10% discount for being an Entertainment Member. When I reserved the room my credit card was charged for the 1st nite stay. I booked a "new tower room" for a total of $89.00 per nite. I checked in on 10/31/08 and checked out on 11/2/08. (Problem #1) The check in process was a bit slow, I presented my id and credit card to the rep, little did I know that she was going to authorize a $240.00 hold on my credit card for just for a 2 nite stay, when I had already paid for the first night. I did not find this out until I was signing the paperwork, I questioned this and I was told that this was a security deposit and that any unused funds would be refunded to me at checkout. I understood, however I just wish that the rep had warned me in advance about this because now I had alot less available credit to use on my trip. (Problem #2) went up to the 5th floor where my new tower room was, after about 20 mins. of getting settled in and unpacking I come to find out the toilet would not flush. I went downstairs and waited in line for at least 15 mins just to complain about this, when I reached the front desk, the staff was friendly about the complaint and immediately gave me a different room on the 4th floor. The new tower room itself was very nice, clean, and modern, comfy beds, a nice window view, a huge flat screen tv (which only gets about 5 channels), coffee maker, and iron / board upon request. (Problem #3) On Sunday 11/2/08 a couple hours before checkout, I found that my shower was getting no hot water, most likely due to several other guests taking showers at the same time. (Other Comments) I did order a steak dinner for a good price in the upstairs restaurant, it was very good and the waiter was very friendly. As for the Casino, I must say that on the weekend I visited, Terrible's sure had some very tight paying machines which did nothing but take, take, take and not give anything in return. Based on my experiance I would not reccomend gambling here or anywhere on the strip. If I were to gamble anywhere in vegas it will be at the downtown freemont street casino's. Out of all the time that I spent in this casino, I was never offered a cocktail or a drink of anykind. Staff is ok, seems to be an older kind of staff that is always in a very (slow, relaxed kind of mood)

Reviews.Title: “Great litle gem and free pick up from the airport”
Reviews.Author: royalm
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the airport around 21:00hrs not knowing where to go but when I phoned the hotel I arranged to be picked up 10mins later by their free shuttle. The ride to the hotel was less than 8mins and when I arrrived the check-in time was the shortest I ever made. I was given my room and when I saw it, I was not dissapointed. It was spacious, clean, had a nice flat screen television on the wall. There was also, coffee making facilities. The bathroom was big and clean. The staff were always pleasant and polite. once you get through the casino area, the place is very peaceful especially the rooms overlooking the pool. Although, the hotel is about 15/20mins walking from the strip, there are frequent buses from across the road. These buses goes pass the strip. When returning back to the hotel, the stop at Bally's will get you to the stop just outside Terrible's hotel. The food was a bit hit and miss but the buffet is good value. They have the best value drinks in town except the 99c margaritas at Flamingo's on the strip. It cost $10/12 per a drink at TI or any other big hotels on the strip but only £2.75 and you can get it anytime of the day or night. (what more do you want)? My brother stayed at TI on the strip and he was very impressed with my room at Terrible's. His honeymoon room was the same size and he was paying more. Hardrock cafe is just up the road and other shops are nearby as well. overall, we love the place and the great value for the price. It you join their club you can get beers for as little as 95c and other great bargains using the book of vouchers given to you. I don't gamble so cannot really say much about the casino only that it is much smaller that the bigger hotels. We would stay here again on future trips back to Vegas. Great little gem of a place. LOVED Terrible's

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain”
Reviews.Author: IMJBS
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for one night, October 9th for $37.00 on Expedia. For this price we were not disappointed. We arrived at 8:30 am and they were more than happy to give us our room even though check in was not until 3. Our room was a basic king bed & bedding but it did have a new flatscreen tv and a view of the pool. We tried the breakfast buffet and it was just ok, but we only paid $5.38 for two since we had a coupon. The location is great, with in walking distance of the Hard Rock and CVS. We had a rental car so we didn't walk that far away. The casino was clean and so was the room. I would defintely stay here again if we get a rental car again!

Reviews.Title: “Great inexpensive place for a night or two”
Reviews.Author: MrsD11432
Reviews.Content: We booked one night way early thru the hotel website for a nightly rate of $29.99 w/ free breakfast and $30 slot bonus. We had a reservation for MGMSignature for 5 nights but because our flight came at midnight, we had chosen not to "waste" one day's rate for just a couple of hours sleeping in the Signature. We also got our rental car the following morning. Terribles has a free shuttle to/from airport which was waiting for us - we called while collecting our luggage at the carousel. Check-in was quick, no wait but again, it was midnight. Our room was clean and nice with 2 queen beds, plasmaTV and view of the pool area. In the morning we had our breakfast buffet; well worth when free and even with the $4.99 ($2.99 for kids, 3yr and under free) price tag. I took the free shuttle back to he airport to get rental car while my husband took the kids at the pool, which is very large, clean and at the time had nobody else in. Very enjoyable. Hotel has a basic gym and a free internet PC in the gym area. Terribles is a great choice if you need a CHEAP place for a night or two or want to save a couple of bucks when flying in extra late or flying out extra early - free airport shuttle is convienet and takes just 10-15min. If you don't get turned off by a possible long hike in dreary hallways and very smokey casino to get to your room, for the price this is a great option. No luxury by any means but a clean, roomy place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel for its Value!”
Reviews.Author: gemini_baby0608
Reviews.Content: Don't let it's name fool you! It's an awesome hotel! Very luxurious! We stayed in the newer part of the hotel, and really enjoyed our stay. Pros: 1.) Huge plasma television (though - there's not many channels, but you didn't come to vegas to stay in your room and watch tv all night anyway). 2.) Very clean! 3.) Really cheap - $35/night and buffets = $10/person (Buffet isn't worth going to if you're a vegetarian). And we got a free $20 free slot and play for staying at the hotel Cons: 1.) Not many channels on TV 2.) Far from strip (you probably can't hike it from here to the strip) 3.) Players Club line is insanely long. Overall, it was the best hotel i stayed in on my trip to the U.S. and the best bargain as well! Will come again!

Reviews.Title: “Not as Terrible as people say”
Reviews.Author: cybersal21215
Reviews.Content: Booked a room at Terrible’s Las Vegas, literally at the last minute – a few hours before heading to the airport. A friend and I were going to Vegas for a mutual friend’s party; I decided to leave for Vegas a day earlier than planned and meet her where she was staying that first night. The room was booked over the phone with a friendly reservations agent using the $59.00 rate with $50.00 free slot play. When we arrived at the hotel at 11:00pm, there was no line at the small check-in counter. I was assigned a non-smoking room (very important!) with two queen beds. No problem – I’m 5’2”, so two beds is fine. The room is what you’d expect at a Days Inn or Comfort Inn: besides the two beds there was a flat screen tv, separate vanity area with sink, shower/tub and w.c., and the a/c cranked out the BTU's. My comments, and these are observations, not complaints: while the room had a coffee maker, there was no coffee and no mugs; there were no cups in the room; and the water didn’t get as hot as I’d like. Also, typical of so many Vegas hotels, the room was a long walk from the elevator bank. Not a problem for me, but this might be for other folks.
